description:
The chicken kabob here is straight up perfect. Somehow they manage to get a serious charcoal-flavored sear on the outside while the inside is bursting with juiciness. It also comes with two kinds of rice and a bit of cucmber/tomato salad, so there's some nice variety on the plate.

That's really the only entree I order here, but as a side I often get the sabzi as well - spinach and mushrooms with an assertively buttery flavor. Great for dipping their bread in.
author: Hervert C.

description:
DO NOT SUPPORT THIS BUSINESS!!!
Ghetto owner who thinks he is the king of Afghan who known to treat customer awfully. 
I guess they are super busy cooking in the kitchen the moment they get to US and forgot to go to school to gain any education therefore they act like street gang. 
READ OTHER REVIEWS FOR YOURSELF!
health department needs to visit this hole ASAP regarding to cleanliness, yucky disgusting smelly kitchen/restaurant.
author: Kate J.

description:
Worked late, no time to cook. Still have to feed minor child thanks to pesky laws that require me to keep her alive until age 18.

*shakes fist*

Went on Yelp and looked for Middle-Eastern/Mediterranean delivery options, because those are usually on the healthy side. Found De Afghanan Kabob House and ordered a lamb kabob plate, a beef kabob plate, a potato and garbanzo side order, and some plain yogurt. Also upgraded all the rice from plain to seasoned for a couple of dollars more.

Food comes. I tell the minor child to divide the meat so that we both get some of each.

A few minutes later I notice minor child Hoovering up rice and meat. I become alarmed...will there be anything left for ME?!

I attempt to stall her by urging her to try the potato and garbanzo side. To appear legitimate, I try it myself. Holy mother-trucking heck...it's DELICIOUS! Spicy, tangy, and herby, with great textural variety between the soft potato and the firm garbanzos.

While I'm doing my own Hoovering on that side dish, my tax deduction takes advantage of the distraction by opening the second dinner container and digging into MY portion of meat and rice. I remind myself that she's a growing human in a GOOD way (vertically), while I'm a growing human in a BAD way (horizontally), so I beg her to at least leave me half of the second plate. She takes mercy on me and finally backs away from the table. With what's left, I'm able to cobble together a somewhat decent dinner.

While I wasn't able to amortize this delivery into a second day of meals, I'm still very pleased. The meat chunks were tender and smoky and nicely grilled, and both meats were of good quality. The potato and garbanzo salad was out of this world...I am so in love with it! Very glad that I ordered that extra side of it for tomorrow.

Four stars = Yay! I'm a fan.
author: Valeria R.

description: De Afghanan serves up some pretty good Kabobs.  They are juicy, flavorful, and healthy.  The rice is well cooked - you can taste every grain.  The meat has tons of flavor and the cucumber salad is a good refresher.  I would give this place a 4 star review for pretty good food, small-ish portions and sorta high prices.  I think what made this a 5 star review was the fact that the staff was very nice and accommodating.  They even sent out a complimentary dish from the chef.
author: Anthony C.

description: One of handful authentic Afghan restaurants in San Francisco. Food is great , I love Afghan bread which is typically served on the side. Loved their mint chutney sauce as well. I ended up getting Quabili Pallow which comes with a lamb shank. Delish!!!
author: Madhu J.

description:
Really cozy and quaint restaurant on Geary near Van Ness, there are only about 10 tables and 1 waiter.  They don't have alcohol here but you can bring in your own wine and there is a liquor store 2 blocks away on Geary.

The menu has  a mix of Persian/Middle Eastern and Ethnic Afghan options.  I've gotten the Mantoo Dumplings a couple of times which seem to be the most authentic Afghan dish.  The Chaplee Kabob with ground beef and 2 types of rice is good if you are hungry because it's very filling.  If you like spicy I'd recommend the Borani Bademjan for an appetizer which comes with bread and a couple of sauces.

Parking is tricky but if you come right at or after 6pm there is ample parking outside since it's tow away until 6pm.
author: Joan W.

description: De Afghan is SO SOLID! It is super reasonably priced, very tasty, and the people who work there are always the best. It's one of the stars of the TL and I would definitely recommend it if you are in the area. I usually get the sheer chai which is sweet and super good. I also get the kabobs and upgrade the rice to the seasoned rice with carrots and raisins. The upgraded rice is so worth it in my opinion. One of the best things at this place! I love the chicken but all the other kabobs are great as well. My boyfriend's favorite is the chaplee kabob which is a  spicy ground beef. In addition, the bread that he kabob comes with is so good as well. Always soft and warm. Definitely check it out!
author: Jocelyn K.

description:
BEST. KABOBS. EVER. This place was so delicious! As soon as I walked in, the place was packed with lots of people! We had a wait of about 30 minutes but it was so worth it! I came here with my family and we ordered: 
1. kabob platters 
2. Sautéed eggplant 
3. Mintoo - beef dumplings with yogurt 
4. Spicy chickpeas with potatoes 

If i had to pick my favorite dish off the menu it would be the combination kabob platter which had beef and chicken with rice and salad! Make sure to order individual platters because one person can easily finish a platter by themself. I've been to a good amount of Afghanistan joints but this one is so fresh and authentic! The meat did not smell and was extremely JUICY!!! I also love the fact that the meat is Zabiha Halal which can be hard to find in the city!
author: Safia K.

description: I live in Roseville and i had to drive to San Fransisco to take care of something and i got hungry and decided to search for an afghan food and i find out they have this location in San Fransisco because i tried their other two locations also, i order Combination and i have to say that was the best food i have ever had in a restaurant, if i was close to this place i would go there every day, i would go there every time i go to San Fransisco now. Best Kabob ever
author: Mohammad S.

description: I love the food here and have returned several times, sometimes with my baby and sometimes with my mom-- who are both picky eaters, but enjoy the food. We are vegetarian, and love the pumpkin challow dish. The bread is amazing, and the spicy sauces they give you on the side make the meal even better. They used to not have high chairs which was a downer, but now they do. I'll keep visiting :)
author: Jigesha D.

description:
Update: Love and consistency every time. Love this place. 

What can I say that hasn't already been said? I agree 100% that this place is and should be number one in your book for Afghanan foods. I recommend you order the melt in your mouth beef kebab (if that's your thing), and savory rice. With delivery I received fresh salads (potato and garbanzo bean & the chopped veggie salad), light bread, and a bright and flavorful dipping sauce. Everything wa
author: Asia S.

description:
Food was great. No complains except that that waiter was not checking on us frequently, we had to raise a hand for times to get her to come to our table even though the place is relatively small. 
But nevertheless, the Kabab was juicy, and the bread was fresh. We will be back.
author: Mohamed E.

description: I went here last night with a friend, and as a fan of the OG De Afghanan in Fremont I was wondering whether this outpost would deliver that level of quality, but did it ever deliver! I ordered the Chicken Kabab plate, which came with rice and a cucumber salad. The boneless chicken was grilled to tender perfection - moist on the inside, crisp grill texture on the outside, seasoned really well, just spicy enough. My friend ordered the Chicken Qorma plate, which is similar chicken pieces but in gravy, which he definitely enjoyed. My friend also got the firni dessert - rice pudding with rose water/pistachio flavoring. We were very happy with our meal, but one thing I will say is that serving size could be a little bigger for the price we are paying. That being said, I am definitely going to be back for this comfort food that reminds me of home.
author: Farrah N.

description: We love this place. The chaplee kabob is the best. We always get the combo plate which has a good sampling. We generally do Uber eats but it's even better when you eat at the restaurant because the food is super hot and fresh.
author: Yasi N.

description: Freshly made with personal spices. Their meat has a distinct flavor which is not the routine variety of meat. As they say good meat is bought. The rice is also well made. The mint chutneys are also fresh and has a kick to it. It is a popular local favorite. Their were ten plus people waiting outside. I can yesterday and again today. Will come back again soon too.
author: Zulfiqar A.

description:
Very solid middle eastern food. There are not many places to enjoy traditional middle eastern food but De Afghanan gets it done. The green salsa that comes with the kebab plate will become your new addiction- spicy but tasty. 

I ordered the chicken kabob plate- very tender, not super strong on flavor which paired well w the rice/salad/salsa. Definitely would drop by here again when I'm in the mood for something unpretentious that reminds me of home.
author: Arezou A.

description:
I left the AMC Van Ness theater in search for a comforting meal and stumbled upon De Afghanan Kabob House (right around the corner of the theater), and boy am I glad I did! Best kabob I have had in SF - hands down!

This place is a casual Afghan restaurant serving up the usual dishes you'd expect (kabobs, qabili, borani). 

I decided to try the Chicken Kabob plate - my go to order at Afghan restaurants. This dish is fire!! Chicken kabobs are far too often dry and under flavored, but De Afghanan does not make this mistake. The meat was SO tender and flavorful (addictive lemony seasoning on top) and I know for sure I haven't had a chicken kabob in this city that can beat it. It came with rice, about 5-6 good sized pieces of chicken, and some mixed cucumber. Top it off with some unbeatable homemade green chutney they give on the side and you have yourself a winning dish. They also provide a free side of Afghani bread to dip into the chutneys and that was buttered well and fresh tasting. 

Head over here to get some amazingly flavorful kabobs, not to mention perfectly cooked :).
author: Sabina S.

description:
Came on a Sunday night with two friends and we were immediately seated. Most orders seemed togo so the restaurant was fairly empty. 

We all ordered the beef kabob and the food came out within 10 minutes. The meat here is so juicy and tasty, I just wish there was more meat although plenty of rice. There was also an unassuming pepper on the plate that's extremely spicy and I'd take caution when trying it. 

Never had Afghanistan food before although it's very similar to middle eastern food. Overall I liked the food and I'd come again.
author: Edward W.

description:
Ever since I moved to SF, I've found that the ratings were not as reliable in the city. However, this restaurant is everything that the reviewers raved about. We ordered the egg plant dish as appetizer, mantoo (dumplings), and chicken kebabs for lunch after a movie right around the corner. And everything we tried was so delicious. Even the sauces, pepper flakes - literally EVERYTHING.

They are also very friendly. They took us despite their almost kitchen closing. We chatted up our waiter, and he said all their ingredients- meats, everything is fresh (nothing from the freezer).

I am so happy that they do delivery, I will be back and delivering everything on their menu at least once!
author: Sung Hee P.

description:
I've heard good things about this place and I've never had afghani food before so I decided to finally try it. I came here for lunch and got the following items:

1) Bolani - this was really delicious.  It's like a pancake filled with potato and scallion served with a yogurt sauce.  It reminds me of Indian dolsa.  They also bring over an Indian green chutney which I also used on it. This is a pretty large dish; I would be surprised if a group less than 4 people finished it. If you do decide to get it expect to take the unfinished portions home, it'll be hard to take the dipping sauces home without spilling and the pancake doesn't keep well. It gets soggy. You can try pan frying it which might help. 

2) Triple kabob - chaplee and beef were delicious.  The chicken was good. The chaplee comes in like a patty of hamburger-like meat mixed with vegetables and spices.  It was mildly spicy and delicious. The beef was also delicious. The chicken reminded me of chicken tandoori.  I liked using the green chutney on it also.  

Overall, the food was like a mix of persian food with indian food. The kebob and rice felt persian while the dolsa like bolani, green chutney and chicken tandoori like kebab felt Indian.  I don't have other Afghani places to compare this too but I liked the foot here and would definitely recommend it. 

TL/DR: The food is like a mix of persian and indian foods. Bolani comes in a large portion for larger groups and the best kebabs were the chaplee and beef. I liked this place and would recommend it.
author: Jon P.

description:
Shout out to Harris for being awesome! My friends and I were in town visiting and the food was amazing. Harris recommended many dishes for us to try as well as the amazing dessert! It was a full house and he made us feel like we were the only ones. Customer service on point! I recommend finding street parking or going down to Amc and walking. This place truly deserves 100/10 :)

Thanks! Will be back for more chai, dessert and food :)
author: Tanya B.

description: As good as the kabobs can get! Got the trio platter of chappli, chicken, and beef kabobs and each of them was worthy of remembrance. The kabobs were all tender and flavorful but I have to say that the service was subpar, when we walked in, we had to walk half way into the restaurant to be greeted by one of the employees that I later noticed was just posted up in a corner being lazy. Same person did not bring us our drinks until right before the entrees. Bottom line: Kabobs are great but service needs major upgrade
author: Ahsan R.

description: This place is cozy and has at most 10 tables. It's the type of place you'd come on a weekday after work either alone or with a few friends like in an episode of Friends. It has that homey feeling. The food itself is also delicious. I usually order the Teka Kabob (beef), which is my favorite or if you want variety, the Triple Kabob is a great alternative. The Sheer Chai is Afghan version of milk tea and it warms me on any cold, foggy SF night. I can't speak to the other dishes but I don't need to.
author: Lillian C.

description:
This is our go to Afghan restaurant.  It is a bit of a trek for us but we think it's worth it.  My husband is Afghan and he is very picky about his Afghan food.  
Our usuals are triple kabob, chapli kabob, bolani with half leeks and half butternut squash.  We also are big fans of sabzi( spinach) so we usually get a side of that.
Do not, repeat, Do not leave without having their Afghan Ice cream.  Get it with the rice noodles and whey cream(khaymauk).  It's almost worth to drive just to eat that!!  
Go for the food, service is challenging and expect to wait to get seated and served.  It's worth it if you know this going in.
The stars are for the food.  Service is a 2.
author: donna a.

description: This a very small place around the corner, with limited seating so often there is a wait time. For a vegetarian usually, there is not much choice in a  kabob place, but they had three choices for me! Pumpkin, spinach and eggplant. We ordered the pumpkin and the eggplant, and the later was delicious. The pumpkin dish was also good but a bit sweet for my pallet. The most exceptional dish for me was their bread, it was yummy with the eggplant and the brown rice. The rice was extremely flavorful and overall it was an enjoyable dinner. Would go back for the eggplant and the rice!
author: Premila M.

description:
Best, most tender, moist and flavorful lamb kebabs, north of Fremont and west of Kabul!  Good authentic kabobs so hard to find in SF!  Small hidden gem on Geary Blvd/Van Ness.

Service was nice and genuine. Felt right at home!
author: J H.

description: De Afghanan is by far producing consistently delicious kebabs that are so well cooked and marinated that they are tender and full of wonderful umami flavors. The service is always great and friendly either dining in or taking out. Their beef, lamb, and chicken kabobs are so delicious, that it's really hard to share so we always end up getting two of the combination kabob plates. There are times when their dinner service is fairly busy but if you find yourself having to wait, trust me and many other yelpers, it is well worth the wait.
author: Taffany H.

description:
This spot is legit for Afghani food! It's definitely a neighborhood gem. The menu has most of the traditional and popular items and the prices are just right especially for the big portion. 

Me and my friend started off with Mantoo which are dumplings stuffed with seasoned ground beef and topped with yogurt. This is worth it for $15 and is meant to share with another person. Next, our second appetizer was this pumpkin cubed jelly-type dish which was delicious and refreshing to the palate. It's a bit sweet too, so it adds on some sweetness. 

For our main dish, we both had the triple kabob plate ($21) which is probably the most popular item on the menu. It's a big plate with tekka beef kabob, grilled chicken kabob which are big pieces of cubed slices, and of course one of my favorites, the chaplee. Each item is grilled to perfection. I recommend ordering a side of yogurt to add onto the rice for more texture and a basket of their bread for more taste. 

I love this place and I'll be definitely coming back for more!
author: Allister D.

description: Great service but the food was really bad!! The rice was very dry and had no taste it's was warmed up. Manto was warmed as well and didn't taste anything like actual Manto. This place really disappointed me :(
author: Joseph M.

description:
This is a wonderful little restaurant right across the street from the new CPMC hospital. One can only imagine how busy this place will be when the hospital and medical building open.

First of all the menu is very simple: a few appetizers, a few mains and a few desserts. That is a good thing. We ordered three different Kabobs and each was very good.

You are first served fresh baked Afghani bread and potato salad. The bread is great with both the green curry that is on the table as well as the spicier red chili sauce.

The potato salad is very unique and good. Definitely try it 

 The chicken had a wonderful Saffron flavor and was really succulent. It wasn't a large portion but good enough for $14.99. 

The Tekka beef was also wonderful. Large chunks of juicy sirloin steak. Again not a ton of meat but a good portion for $14.99

Finally we also ordered the lamb Kabob($19.99): You could tell the meat was super fresh not frozen. Simply prepared and awesomely tasty. Ordered with this was the special spicy rice ( $1 extra). I don't know if it is worth it but it was good. Actually their basic rice was really good. 

The two desserts were hit and miss: The baklava was mushy and very unappealing. The vanilla ice cream with, fresh cream, cardamom, and rose water was refreshingly good. I am not a rose fan but this subtle flavor was really good with the rich cream and ice cream.

I think the combination of friendly service, beautiful art, and tasty and moderately priced meals adds up to  a great place to check out!
author: David G.

description: I do love this place, seems like it's family ran, good food and good prices. We got the triple kebabs and the lamb shank rice pilaf. The kebabs weren't as tender as what I remembered the last time we ordered it, which was disappointing, but the rice pilaf was most excellent. I love the bits of raisins in the rice to give it a different dimension of flavor. Also loved the chai with milk. Yum yum!
author: Alice W.

description:
Great authentic Afghan food! 


Let's start with the food, delicious. Coming from Afghanistan and being raised in an afghan family.. i could fully vouch for this place! The food is all freshly made basically right in front of you (tables are next to the kitchen). The noise is minimal and the temperature in there is perfect. 

Getting here isn't too difficult but parking could be very tricky. Once you get in if you're extremely lucky, there will be a seat available. Expect to be waiting for a few minutes. Regardless it is absolutely WORTH THE WAIT. 

For starters, you must get the Bolani. Both times coming here we got the Chaplee Kabob with a side of Naan, and both times it's been great. You'll probably have some leftovers, specially of the meat, as they serve a very healthy portion. 

Enjoy!
author: Yousaf Z.

description: I was unsatisfied with my service tonight due to the waitress arguing about an order that was misplaced originally by her. Instead of saying "I apologize let me get this fixed" she says "oh you actually told me this order" customer service is a HUGE deal for me and I am very disappointed because I thought highly of this location. I hope you take this as positive criticism, take care.
author: Kabir A.

description:
Let me start by saying, this is wayyy better than the de afghanan in Livermore. Food wise. 

The kabobs were more flavorful, the portions were bigger. Not really anything bad you can say about afghan food to begin with. 

The host was nice enough to ask a two person party to move to a smaller table to accommodate our bigger party. 

Minus one star for:

The menu said triple kabob was $20.99, got home and realized the receipt said $21.99. Wasn't too much of a big deal to me, combo kabobs tend to be more pricy. 

The extra order of seasoned rice (size of a small saucer) was $5.

Small location, but then again this is SF Tenderloin. Can't really expect a big location.
author: Sanz E.

description:
Think it says something when all the other patrons seem to be afghani - food must be top notch right? Right. 

Service was on the slower side, which when you are bordering "hangry," seems especially pronounced. 

Chaplee kebab delicious 

Chicken qorma was tender with a great blend or aroma and spices. 

Bolani with pumpkin with flavorful and aromatic. Large portion so maybe want to think about ordering with a larger party. 

And that afghan ice cream your probably really came here for? Yes it's absolutely divine and sinful.

And the firni pudding is like a light fluffy rendition of the aromatic ice cream. Yummy.
author: Long C.

description: The Mantu is delicious here!! The kabob plates are great too. Good quality meat! This is a go-to spot for my husband and I. You can place orders to go as well. If you want to dine in I would call ahead as the seating inside is slightly on the smaller side!
author: Sophia K.

description:
We shared the chicken and beef kabob plate. We like the beef best.  It was super flavorful. The chicken seemed a bit dry, but still we liked it.

Comes with rice, cucumber salad and bread.  She gave us a garbanzo and potato with cilantro sauce little tasting, and we loved it

$20 after tax and tip

The only bad part, today at lunch, was a table next to us, where one of the group of three women had a very LOUD voice and she ruined a nice lunch with her non stop talking   

I finally stopped talking and listened to her LOUD  dull blabbering for the remaining 30 minutes of lunch 

So rude!!!! People you aren't the only customers  in there !
author: Foodlover B.

description:
The kebobs are really good at this place. I had combination plate which has 3 chunks of chicken and 3 chunks of beef kebob, plus rice and a small salad. They were cooked perfectly, completely cooked, appropriately juicy, and the seasoning was awesome. I think they are using high quality saffron for their chicken kebob, which is more yellowish, smells and tastes better than cheap reddish saffron that used in most restaurants. 
The rice was a little dry but more healthy. Having a small butter on the side could solve this issue. 
Another positive point, it was very quiet
author: Ali M.

description:
Mmmmm. We got the triple kabob, mantoo, and the bolani eggplant dish. Everything was delicious. The kabobs were so moist. The mantoo was so flavorful and its skin was paper thin. Also don't forget to ask for the cilantro chutney!!

Also, get the ice cream. If you don't like your desserts too sweet, this is for you. It's very simple - vanilla ice cream topped  w heavy cream, rose water, and pistachio......Soo good. It has cardamom but I couldn't taste it.
author: Connie N.

description: What a great find. It's a small non-pretentuous place excellent food. Kebobs are juicy and delicious.
author: Ilya K.

description: I wish I could give these people -0 star for their customer services we were waiting more than 1 hour for them to open they should have open at 4:00 pm but was 4:10 when my cousin knocked the door to find out if they are even open that day , the afghan guy with short beard came out opened and start coursing at us and said there are a lot of other restaurants go out there he was hella disrespectful , he didn't know anything about customer service, I believe for them it is all about money I would rather go somewhere else at-least they know how to respect other people
author: Tawab K.

description: Great food! The entree portions were on the small side so definitely consider getting some appetizers as well.
author: Amanda F.

description: The fremont location has better food and better customers service the guy who works there is a rude person ......... guys go somewhere that respects you , i had heard from other people afghans are very famous in thire hospitality specially when it comes to food ,  but if all afghans are like them then it is a wrong expression
author: Wahab N.

description:
The best afghan food in the Bay Area period.

Every week my girlfriend and I stop by and get the Beef Tekah with brown rice and it's amazing every........single......freaking.....time.

I'll keep coming here till the day I die lmao
author: Masoud A.

description:
This being my first lick of Afghanistan food, I don't have anything to compare it with. 
I ordered potato and scallion Bolani and Chicken Qorma.
Definitely underestimated the portion of the Bolani as appetizer. It can feed 2-3 people. 
Crispy on the outside without it being awfully oily. The filling has a hint of sourness (good sour, like somewhat tangy).
The chicken Qorma is typical of middle eastern dish/stew, in which it uses a lot of spice, but milder than most middle eastern dishes I've tasted. It's savory and somewhat sweet with a silky texture (easy to go down). Even better when it coupled with that green sauce on the table.
I say it was definitely a good first time.
author: Jenny T.

description: Ordered delivery and over an hour later the food still isn't here. Wouldn't order from here again for delivery.
author: Frank P.

description: Got the lamb special as well as the triple special. Service and food is AMAZING!! Definitely a place that you'll always return to and be a regular customer. Chill space. Love it.
author: Dee P.

description: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. One server runs the entire place and is so rude. We were a party of 4, he didn't clean the table and practically threw each item at our table as he brought it over. I asked if we could have the table cleaned as there was sumac still on the table from the last people he got annoyed and rolled his eyes. We stayed because we like their food and it's halal. I absolutely hate this location, I would rather drive to Fremont to other awesome Afghan restaurants and enjoy their customer service.
author: Pakiza C.

description:
There is only one place I go when it comes to Afghan food -- De Afghanan. A gf introduced me to the one in Fremont (thank goodness they opened this SF location!!)

The spinach, eggplant, lamb shank, and the mixed kebob plate are what we order EVERY single time. If we bring friends, we'll also order the potato and leek bolani and sometimes the chapli as well. I can also literally go through the entire jar of chutney by myself.. Ugh, this place is so good! Not in a great location, being in the Tenderloin, but meh.. this resto is worth it.
author: Kim I.

description: This place looks unassuming but is a must visit in SF! Their chicken kebabs were some of the most flavorful I have ever had! I also got the drink dough which was light and refreshing! I wish I was hungrier so I could have eaten but will definitely be back to try more of their dishes!
author: Rachel N.

description: Been eating here since the first week it opened on Geary. Great food. The Chapli kebabs are so good but lately, they have become way too spicy. Too much Chilli. Tone it down a bit, will ya? Thanks!
author: noflaps c.

description:
The food here is delicious. We had the chicken kabob and the tekka beef kabob. Both had excellent flavors and were really tender. Between both dishes, I liked the beef more as that was really nicely cooked. The dishes came with basmati rice and a chopped cucumber tomato salad. Minus 1 star as I didn't think that they gave enough rice with the entrees. It was just enough food to be full but not very full.

Small restaurant space so it can feel a little crowded.
author: Ali F.

description: Great food. Excellent quality food. Very tasty. We arrived at 5pm for an early dinner with no one there. Soon after the place started filling up. Great chapli and chicken kabobs!
author: Shabina M.

description: It's hard not to say anything but wow. Got the triple kabob was great and good sample of what they have to offer. The appearance of the food was beautiful and surprised me, it's clear they care in the quality of the food they serve.  Highly recommend!!!!
author: Art K.

description: YUM! Everything is good here. The prices seem high for a not-so-fancy establishment, but any entree here will fill you up with plenty of leftovers to enjoy the next day. If you like kabobs, the chapli kabobs are incredibly good and incomparable to other Afghan places. The chicken kabobs are a close second. I substituted my rice for kabuli palao but wish I had gotten an entire extra platter of it. The best part is that they have vegetarian options (appetizers and entrees) too
author: Neekta H.

description: Our first afghani cuisine. Well, not entirely first! Had afghani bread before and the bread basically prompted me to try out their food. Triple kabab platter was a winner. Chapli kabab, beef and chicken kababs were ridiculously soft and juicy. Qabuli lamb polao was overrated in my opinion, as it was bland but the green and red sauces came to rescue, wouldn't have it again. And last, the bread! Soft, flaky, a bit of crustiness from the sesame seeds went absolutely well with cardamom infused milk tea. A must have!
author: Afnan Z.

description:
Carry out order for a nice day by the beach after Bay To Breakers.  It was a late late lunch ...we were craving for some Middle eastern food.  I normally get Persian cuisine when I get the craving but a friend suggested this place.  I had Afghani cuisine before and last time i had something Afghani was in AZ hahaha and it was not good at all.  The food at this place is awesomely delicious!!  We ordered all kinds of dishes from kabob, bolani, eggplant dish, and a dessert.  The service was super quick and the hostess was super awesome!! 

By the way...we ate our food (on the beach) near the Maritime Museum..we spread our food nicely like picnic ..and people were asking where we got the food...they thought it was by Fisherman's Wharf...we told them ...they need to drive a bit to get it ..
author: Jing F.

description:
This restaurant is easily the best kept secret in San Francisco! I'm embarrassed to say that I was completely unfamiliar with Afghan food prior to this experience and I know now that I was definitely missing something. We had several dishes and they were all fantastic. 
The Qabili (braised lamb shank) was amazingly tender and served with basmati rice which was studded with raisins and julienned carrot. The Bolani (a bread stuffed with potatoes) was easily my husband's favorite and came with a perfect yogurt dipping sauce. We also ordered the Triple Kabob plate and had no complaints there either. The chicken breast and tri tip were super tender and flavorful but the star of that plate was the chaplee, a spicy ground sirloin patty. The chaplee isn't for the kiddies due to the spiciness but my husband and I loved it. 
Anyone in San Francisco needs to check this place out. It's a family run restaurant with real pride in their food and it shows. This meal was definitely my favorite in a two week stint of trying everything we can in the city.
author: Jacqui N.

description: Yes good food. Amazing seasonings, if your a foodie you won't be let down here. Everything was fabulous !
author: John H.

description: We love this place! My husband introduced me to this spot a few years ago and whenever we go to see a movie at the AMC around the corner we always eat here. There is a location in Fremont as well. This place is very unassuming and quiet. The food is on point. We had a late lunch when we went for dinner, so we just split a few things. We initially wanted to order delivery and stay in- but they don't deliver everything that is offered at restaurant- dogh OR bolani- so we had to get over there. We had a bit of a wait (about 15 minutes- the place is small), but food came fairly quickly. Highly recommend the cool dogh (yogurt drink with cucumber and mint), the potato bolani (you will prob have leftovers and they are delicious all the same) with a thick yogurt dipping sauce and green and red chutneys similar to (but not the same as) Indian chutneys. My husband and I also split the lamb plate that comes with two different kinds of rice, huge chunks of lamb, and a small salad with tiny diced cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. So good!!! We will definitely be back here again.
author: Zinia G.

description:
Had lunch here with my niece and family and wow it was fantastic!!! Seriously, we had the bolani, and the kabobs, lamb kabob, teka (beef) kabob, and the triple combo kabob (chicken, beef, chaplee which is the beef patty with spices) and it was all yummy, delicious!!!

The service is great and friendly and the quality of meat, perfectly marinated, juicy and tender. We will definitely be back to try everything else on the menu.

Highly recommend this restaurant!!!
author: Michael C.

description: Very good food. Nice menu selection. The lamb shank did come cold though. Only one waiter. They need to hire more people.
author: Yasser H.

description:
If I were not aware how it has to be Afghan dishes then I can think thats the Afghan rice, bolani, kebab etc.. and then I don't have to wait a good taste from whatever I eat. 
Dishes were not fresh and of course not tasty. You can find much more delicious foods around there instead of paying that much money for them. Rude waitress who is looking like only one Afghan in Afghan restaurant and answering my question about an Afghan dish 'I'm only waitress here'.
author: Ely O.

description: Great authentic Afghan food. Very small spot, opt for take out.
author: Rabia H.

description: Of all kabob houses I've went to, De Afghanan Kabob House is probably the worst one yet. As you guys can see, it says that it's open at 4 pm, but when my family and I went there we had to wait for over an hour. My brother decided to knock on the door and ask why they refused to open the door. The man that opened the door shouted at us saying he doesn't want us here, that we should leave, and get our hungry ass' somewhere else. I couldn't believe what had happened no person should be disrespected like that. We came here to have food. If you didn't want us here you could have politely said that you guys were closed for another hour or for the rest of the day and we would have left with no problem at all. The people are very rude and disrespectful I would not recommend this place for anybody.
author: Mursal A.

description: Great food! Great service! Spicy dishes that have not been watered down. What I enjoyed most about this place was the authenticity of its flavors and spices. I really enjoyed my meal here and would recommend this restaurant to travelers in the city who are looking for a unique flavorful meal!
author: AZadeh A.

description:
How do you know a restaurant is worthy of five stars? Is it when you manage to scarf down an entire plate even though you are still full from lunch? Or is it when you still longingly think about that plate of kabobs after 3 days? 

I'm really glad that Henry P. recommended this place. I can see why he did! I ordered the Combination Kabob which came with tekka beef and chicken kabobs "charboiled to perfection". At first, I was extremely skeptical because there are so many hyped up restaurants in SF. But, seriously- it was perfection. The tekka beef (marinated tri beef) had a wonderful smoky flavor  and was cooked perfectly. The chicken was tender boneless chicken breast that was moist and juicy. It came with a bed of rice and a small tomato, cucumber rice. There were also two hot sauces, and I liked the green cilantro one alot! 

I loved the complimentary Shor Nakod and flat bread. The Shor Nakod was a wonderful mixture of garbanzo beans and potatoes in this green, citrusy sauce. It was a refreshing way to contrast all the meat we were eating. 

The restaurant can get a bit crowded at times, so I recommend coming early. It's a bit pricier compared to the other restaurants in the area, but definitely worth it.
author: Eva L.

description: Excellent food! However, the one waiter there is rude beyond belief. Most one star reviews mention the same guy. That waiter spoke to the cook and was saying something to the effect of "I'm not their fucking slave" when we asked for bread after sitting there for 10 mins(we were the only customers). That waiter genuinely does not want to be there. Too bad because the chicken kebab is awesome but not enough to outweigh or justify the extreme rudeness and piss poor customer service. The waiter is the brother of the owner, thus nothing will happen.
author: Frank R.

description:
Incredibly crazy good. Order the chicken kabob - it comes as a plate, and you get a very spicy spicy salad (only had a bite so not sure what is in there - I'm a wimp), a potato + chickpea salad, delicious rice, about 5 hefty pieces of fall-apart, marinated, bright-red chicken, and two pieces of incredible flatbread. 

I've ordered this meal twice and both times I've snuck it into the AMC Van Ness, which is literally right around the corner. It's a great meal and I love enjoying it while watching a film.

Not too expensive. I think the chicken plate is 14.99. For the amount of food, I could have easily saved half for lunch and made two meals out of it. But I'm greedy and hungry and I enjoyed every last bite.

I'd like to return and get the pumpkin appetizer!
author: Emily M.

description: Let me be straightforward I am Middle Eastern and I know what a good Middle Eastern food is I've been coming to this place a lot and I know how fresh and good taste it is I still don't get why yelpers don't rate this place five stars I don't usually rate places I don't even use Yelp because I hate how customers under rate a place that deserves more the entitlement they have bothers me a lot while good places like this one serves fresh food excellent tasty food with excellent service and an excellent clean place and still not be rated 5 stars that tells me how much I hate yelpers anyway I'm sorry that I had to explain how entitled people in the city are who pick on everything beside that the food is excellent the service is blessent the food is fresh and the place is probably the cleanest and the waiters are a bless make sure you get the rice with lamb bone
author: Hasan A.

description: I know authentic Afghan food and this place comes the closest I've seen of any other Afghan restaurant I've tried in San Jose, Fremont or SF. The Qabali Palo and mantoo are must tries. Super nice people, family run place.
author: Roxi S.

description: Really great place up on Geary with the best kabobs in the city! Best time to catch a meal is between 4-6 pm (before the dinner rush). Favorite menu items: lamb kabob, combination kabob, and chicken qorma. Enjoy a delicious hot chai with the baklava for dessert.
author: Sarah N.

description:
This place is by far the best kebab House I've ever had
The chicken kebab is my favorite it has so much flavor
The green sauce is delicious more on the spicy side but great I highly recommend this place hope you guys enjoy
author: Robert S.

description: The staff is incredibly nice and the food is incredible.  My husband and I ate here several times while on vacation.  None of the Afghan restaurants we have on the east coast near us come close to this.
author: Meghaan L.

description:
Wow, just wow. I went to a concert last night and searched out what was close in proximity to the Great American Music Hall and De Afghanan Kabob House (with 4.5 stars) popped up. Thank the heavens above! 

I wasn't terribly hungry but, wanted to have a little food for hitting the show so I ordered the chicken kebab. Let me tell you about this chicken kebab as it's no ordinary kebab. I don't think I've ever had something so tender and flavorful come off the grill. Cooked traditionally over an open flame of coals gives the meat a perfect texture. There were two varieties of basmati rice, and a nice little side of diced cold vegtables that went perfectly with the chicken. 

I'll keep this short. Hats off to the best kabob in San Francisco.
author: Benjamin F.

description: Some of the tenderest, most flavorful kabobs I've had in SF. The portions are the right size so that you don't feel overly stuffed after, and at $20/person, it's reasonably priced.
author: Vishay N.

description: We came here for my wife's birthday. we ordered chicken kabob and Tri kabob. The food was absolutely delicious. The seasoning was perfect and the meat was well cooked and no smells. We were so impressed by the service that Wida peovided for us. we were welcomed, got seated fast and our food got ready very quickly. If you like a lot of rice with your kabob, you might as well request it;) overall, it was a good experience. i highly recommend this place.
author: Shahin S.

description: I called this place one time and wanted to know if I could just have dessert but I got turned away. Why do I have to have a meal first before I can have ice cream?
author: Jonny W.

description:
$16 for a kebab platter the size of an appetizer? Techbro preemptively explaining to the waitress that neither he nor his tinder date will tolerate spicy food?  Bruh, since when are kebabs spicy?   

Two stars reflects the sorry scene of San Francisco, more than it does the restaurant itself, which is modest in demeanor and serves superb food despite the high prices and small portions. 

In a better world, De Afghanan would be 5 stars.
author: Javid S.

description:
Quaint  little restaurant off Geary Blvd. As you walk in, you notice an open kitchen with the usa and afghan flags prominently displayed.  You can see the bustling cooks marinating meats on the open flames, and aromas of kabobs and sumac fill the air.  Note.. it can get crowded, so be prepared to wait.  I would say no more than 25 patrons can seat  comfortably in the small space.

Menu was authentic offering traditional Afghan fare.  I ordered the bolani for the appetizer and chappli kabob for entree.. Ordered a milk chai and it was very good. After a few minutes the appetizer came .. omg.. the best eggplant bolani.. delicious..great seasoning and that tangy saucy after taste.. just amazing


For the chappli.. fyi.. they need be moist and on the greasy side with some fat added the  the beef.. When they arrived, the kabobs cameo.o with a helping of qwabli rice, salad and Afghan bread..   Kabobs were very good.. with a hint of spice is expected. they provided green chili sauce and crushed red sauce if you'd like to spice the meat.  However, with chappli, one should relish in the natural flavor of the beef that is marinated in spices i.e. coriander, garlic, red peppers, and traditional Eastern spices..  Great dish.. 

Highly recommend.
author: Amer S.

description: This place was absolutely the bomb dot com. What amazing flavors and dessert. Winner winner chicken dinner good kabobs with just the right amount of spice!  The rose desserts are delicate, but quite packed with flavor! You must try this place if you have not had Afghan food. The cucumber drink is so good. You need to try to it in order to understand.
author: Chris R.

description: AMAZING!! This was my 1st time trying Afghan food & I will definitely be back!! I was torn between the Mantoo Dumplings & Borani Kadoo! I ended up ordering the dumplings & they were sooo delicious! Full of flavor! Subtle spice! The yogurt sauce provided a nice creamy balance to the dish! I went by myself around 5:30p on a Sunday & it was very quiet & peaceful, not busy at all! The place isn't that big, maybe 9 or 10 tables. It was a quiet & peaceful dinner. The woman that waited the tables was nice. She greeted people by their 1st name & had conversations with everyone there including me! I had no problem with the service. The food also came fast for all the tables & was pretty reasonable on price. Overall, authentic place with delicious food! I will be back the next time I'm in town!
author: Ashley B.

description: I was on a business trip and driving around Lombard Street and it was around 9 pm. When I typed halal on yelp app, this kabab House appeared on my result. I was so glad to found a halal restaurant. When I arrived, this place was packed and you can tell by the crowd people are enjoying their food. The lamb chop I had was very juicy, soft and cooked properly and price was not bad either. However they charged me $2-3 for yogurt sauce when it should have been free. I paid and added the tip and left. I was travelling on a business trip, not that I was paying that extra $2-3 but little things like this should be avoided at all cost for a long term goodwill and leaving a great impression for  customers.
author: Abid K.

description: Great food. Recommend the combo kebab platter and the spinach dip appetizer. Restaurant is also very clean.
author: Dante Z.

description:
This place has been on bookmarked for a while and my date took me there recently. This is one of his favorite places in the City and he had told me about it many times before. Even on a weeknight, there was a bit of a wait. As we waited, I was super excited just by looking at everyone else's food.

In an attempt to not overeat, we shared a triple kabob plate (with tekka beef, chicken and chaplee kabob). The chaplee (ground beef and spices) was my favorite and to my surprise, I thought the chicken one was excellent as well; the breast meat retained its juiciness. With the flatbread and dogh yogurt drink, one plate was enough for the two of us.

The food is really great but the prices are not "hole-in-the-wall" cheap.
author: Yi Z.

description: Everything was good, but bread was not authentic.  Roasted eggplant and squash were great; 3 kabob dinner good too.
author: Nancy J.

description: First time here and loved Afghan food very clean and beautiful place the chicken they cook feels like they brought from Afghanistan
author: Amir K.

description: Very tasty food! Love the spices and mix with yogurt that they have. The basmati rice is so light and well cooked -- hard to find similar!
author: Fred G.

description: Have been looking for an Afghan place all over the city and glad I came across this one! Even though the staff messed up my order and I didn't get to try their beef chaplee which was highly rated.. their chicken and beef kabobs were so perfect and fresh. The price is on the higher end (hence the 4 star rating). Would definitely recommend if you're looking to get your kabob and naan on!
author: Moe A.

description:
This is a very cute small restaurant. The food is amazing and very tasty. I come from work and eat here very often. It is not just the best Afghan place, it's one of the best little jewels.

The owner family is so great and always very pleasant to help.

Yesterday though we had an unpleasant experience by a customer that liked super quite because we were enjoying our lunch. Some people are better off staying locked in their home and pulling their curtains. Loners.

The restaurant is great!
author: Panos L.

description: I just finished eating a lamb kabob and i can say that's the best lamb kabob i have ever eaten. Great job guys!
author: Mel C.

description: Nowruz , all restaurants were super booked and we came with no reservation and luckily one table for 2 people were available for us , the server did a great job and the food was delicious. I highly recommend people who lo es again or Persian food
author: Alia S.

description: This is a great place to eat. Everything I have ever had there was fresh, very well cooked, and nicely spliced.  The majority of diners there were Afghan, which speaks to their authenticity. Prices are reasonable, and they obviously care about what they serve.
author: Bob G.

description: I went here today with a friend for a spur of the moment lunch.  One word.  WOW!  This little place has some fantastic food.  We tried the lamb shank and the chicken qorma.  Both stellar.  The lamb was fall-off-the-bone tender with very flavorful rice.  The chicken was tender with a spicy tasty sauce.  The condiments on the table were a fiery red sauce and a green sauce reminiscent of cilantro pesto.  I enjoyed so much that I took a pumpkin bolani home for my wife.  It too was awesome.  The service was great and the overall experience was super.  Can't wait to go again!
author: Matt R.

description: We got 3 different kababs and  Qabeli Powlo. The latter was amazing. For dessert we got Afghan style ice cream which was the best. The restaurant is small and cozy. Don't expect to many services although the food worth it!
author: Zeinab A.

description:
I used to go to the De Afghanan in Fremont, it since I discover it here, this is my preferred restaurant in San Francisco so far 

They have the best chicken kebob I had in my life, (super tasty and tender) and my friends also love the lamb (cannot judge cos I don't eat red meat).

If is your first time here, try to start with the potato bolani (delicious!) and if is too spicy just add the yogurt sauce. For entree I highly recommend the chicken kebob with the pilau rice. 

The deserts are also delicious: Sher-pera, Baklava, Ice Cream with rose water and pistachio, rice pudim...yummy!
author: Raissa K.

description: This place is consistently great. The chicken tikka kabob is seasoned perfectly and grilled up nicely. I like the fresh cold side salad that comes with the meal. Overall this restaurant serves up delicious, healthy, and exotic food! Keep up the great work!
author: Matt C.

description:
This place is amazing. The spicy beef burger patty is to die for. 

The staff is extremely nice and very helpful
author: Luis L.

description: All I can say is OMG! This meal was beyond delish. I ordered the combination and wiped my plate clean. It's hard to find good athletic food, but we definitely found it here.
author: Amanda A.

description: Worst food, rude workers and worst customer service.................,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
author: Walid A.

description:
Wow, people were not kidding when they said the meat here is amazingly tender. I barely needed to cut my beef and chicken!!!

We also had the eggplant appetizer which is incredible. You must get that even if you think you don't like eggplant!! You won't regret it. Paired with the soft, fluffy, and chewy bread they bring out, the texture and flavor combination is fantastic.

The second dish we shared was the dumpling on their specialty menu. Everyone loved it. The only confusion I had with it was that the meat definitely tasted like lamb instead of the advertised ground beef. Anyway, still great but just unexpected.

The sheer chai was also great, although slightly overpriced for what's basically hot milk tea with spices. That being said, it was really well done, so while I probably wouldn't get it again, I'm glad I did this time.

My fiancé and I split the triple combination. Everything was delicious. We didn't notice that Chapli/Chaplee is spicy, so be wary of that! Definitely not unbearable, but it clears the nose.

Last but not least, it was my future father in law's birthday so when they heard that, they brought out a dessert on the house! It was so good - floral, light, creamy, and sweet but not too sweet.
author: Mio W.

description: Two stars instead of one because the food is around the same as the one in Fremont. We came in at around 5:40pm on a Sunday night since we were in the city at the time, and it was extremely busy. So we asked what the wait was for my family of six and we got a rude and vulgar response that indicated the terrible service mentioned in other reviews was 100% true.
author: Adam S.

description: Best Kabobs I have had in San Francisco! Their chutney and Shor Nakhod are excellent too.
author: Mohamed H.

description: Experiencing first time such an awesome Afghani food,,,, nice people , clean area, tasty food, affordable prices and I'll go again .
author: Feroz C.

description: I cannot tell you enough how amazing the food and service is here! The meat literally melts in your mouth. We got the combo with rice and salad on the side. Also got the afghan bread with potato and they gave us some of the green chickpea stuff can't remember the name but it was so delish spicy and garlicky! Yum! Ended up taking a lot of food to go because the servings were quite generous! I always recommend this place to anyone who loves afghan food! It reminds me of my moms cooking so flavorful and tasty!
author: Rita A.

description: Just like the Fremont location there's a lot of love coming out of this kitchen. The serving staff is always on point and the food is always tasty, hot and grubalicous...
author: Al T.

description:
We wanted something different and YELPed this place

I know very little about Afghan food, but it seemed good.  Tri tip kebab platter was the best dish we tried

Pleasant service and 1/2 block from many bus lines on Van Ness.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Small little eatery nearby kabuki.went to a movie yesterday and needed a place to chow down within ez walking distance. Didn't want to hike to the tenderloin or up to Jtown ...and tried a couple places on Polk .... this place is just doors down from Mel's. 5 parties came all around the same time! Abit pricey for lunch (20$per person). We ordered the lamb kebab (about 5 pcs) cones w rice , bread, and a cucumber tomato chutney (salad) that didn't seem to hv any dressing & combo meat lunch platter. 

Once the hospital is up & running it'd be super packed. I hope to come again b4 then lol
author: Tiffany W.

description:
The BOMB! The. Best. Food. Ever. 

Every time I visit SF, I make it a point to come to this place. It's a little tiny hole in the wall with no more than maybe 8 tables. 

It's nothing flashy, just a small casual restaurant. But believe me when I say that the food is to die for. 

The bolani is amazing, the chicken kabob is the best chicken you'll have in your life, these are my personal FAVES. The rice that comes with the kabob is perfectly cooked & flavored. But honestly, everything else on the menu is delicious! 

If you're looking for a delicious meal - this place is it. Big portions, fair prices, and I can't emphasize enough... mouth watering food.
author: Mina H.

description:
I LOVE De Afghanan Kabob House and I crave, sometimes even dream, about eating here. The vegetarian dishes are amazing and the meat it so tender and perfect! This is one of my favorite weekend spots. 

The lamb kabob, shornakod and eggplant dish are my favorites.
author: Francie M.

description: i came to have dinner here for the first time last week and i normally don't write reviews for restaurants considering i eat out A LOT but this place was exceptionally good! the food was like authentic afghan food the ambiance is nice and quite and the service is top notch! the waitress was the icing on the cake! this place has amazing food and great service!
author: Seroun A.

description: Seriously the best meat and chicken I've tasted! The place is a hole in the wall, but the food keeps us coming back! And the prices are very reasonable! Totally recommend!
author: Yasmeen H.

description: Tasty fresh hot food. Small cozy place with beautiful Afghan music playing. Kind people serving food. The ice cream was a bit melt but I didn't mind. We had the triple food and kabuli pawlo. All good and yummy.
author: Majid D.

description: Went with a large group but worth the wait. Vegetarians and meat eaters were all satisfied. I personally got the 3 meat dish which was excellent. The ground meat is a bit spicy though so not for everyone. Also, I'd recommend bringing that dish out with a higher temperature since it takes time to finish. Opted in for the Afghan rice which was the right choice. I suggest they bring out toppings like raisins and what not with every order. Topped things off with the ice cream and headed out with a chai!
author: Omar M.

description: Very disappointed. First time here and everyone raves about the Fremont location but too far for me. $3 for a can of soda and the rice had a smell like it hadn't been washed. No sides with a $20 dish. Do not recommend.
author: Kadejh N.

description: The spinach appetizer was delicious with incredible flavorful bread...and they had a few veggie options for those of us who don't eat the kabob. I ordered the pumpkin which was simple but tasty.
author: Mara S.

description: Incredibly fresh & tender meats. We had the lamb & chicken kabobs with the dumplings and fried pancake. Absolutely delicious. We will definitely be back again!
author: Ashley M.

description:
Excellence is an understatement for this place. The level of efficiency, hospitality, and flavor combo is just utterly undeniable. It is that good. The appetizers for the eggplant dish and chicken korma came out lickety-split. The lamb shank was so tender, so succulent. The combo grills were out of this world. The rice, cooked to perfection. The bread, a crispy texture with fluffy interior. And the salad was refreshing. Even the dogh packed a cleansing punch of yogurt and herbs. 

Worth your attention. Come by ASAP.
author: Ashraf A.

description:
Where have this place been in my life?!?! 

The food here is absolutely amazing! My friend and I decided last minute to meet up for dinner and I had been craving Middle Eastern food so Yelp had suggested this place close to my workplace. 

I had ordered the chicken kabob plate. It came with a skewer of chicken meat (breast I believe)  with a cucumber salad, rice and bread. The meat was amazing with its delicious charred, well-spiced taste! My friend and I suddenly became silent as we were munching thru our food because we couldn't believe how great it was. 

It's definitely one of the best tasting food I have had in SF. I just wished this place was a bit cheaper though or else I would frequent this place almost every week!
author: Henry P.

description: We really wanted to love this place after reading all the positive reviews. We were so excited to see a kebab place. We got the kebob combo (tekka beef and chicken kebob). The meat was dry not like we are used to. The condiments and salad were good. One star Instead of two stars because the service was  particularly bad. Maybe we hit a bad day (Friday evening). It's not worth it for us. There are many better options that deliver on both food and service. And the searc for good kebob continues.
author: Brit G.

description:
10min standing at the door and now it's 10 minutes waiting for the waitress for the order.  Wao 
What a service?
I think it might be the last time to visit this place. Very careless and arrogant staff. Their staff is having a party in front of the kitchen. After a long wait we have left and as we were leaving their staff came and asked another waiting party to sit on our chairs. No sorry no excuse.
What a terrible experience we have here. I have specially drove from Marin to SF to try something new.I will never ever recommend this place to anyone. 
Enjoy losing custumers 
Worst restaurant by far, now I am moving to the one next to it called Mel's.
author: Nadia M.

description:
Rude and possibly racist wait staff. 

As soon as we walked in, the waiter had no interest in seating us or adding us to a list. He said "If you want to wait, you can wait outside." 

We noticed some tables clearing and went inside to enquire. The waiter approached us and rudely told us "I don't know If you can tell, but you're in front of the door."

When we asked why he couldn't seat the two of us at the empty table he said he will only give us a small table. This was despite there being a white couple clearly seated at the same size table.

Horrible experience. I'm glad I didn't eat there only to have to deal with that asshole any more.
author: Sridatta T.

description: Food was ok but ordered with Grabhub and one item was missing I notified grabhub they said they will check with restaurant and get back to me. I notified yelp too. No response yet.
author: E B.

description: The beef kabob is consistently tender, flavorful and really good. Even from someone who rarely eats red meat. The menu isn't huge and it's very casual, small and basic inside but the food is quality and tasty. Tip: Their yogurt sauce style is very thin/runny and plain which is different than a lot of yogurt dips like labne and tzatziki. If you like yogurt, try the drink instead.
author: Piper W.

description:
Stumbled upon this place after the Mensho line was out of control. This is by far the best kabobs I've had in the city and anywhere period. I ordered the Combination Kabob entree and haven't ordered anything else because the chicken and the beef are so juicy, tender and fragrant. Their Afghan bread was warm and amazing as well.

If you're an eggplant fan (even if you're not), definitely try out that appetizer. All of my friends and I enjoyed that paired with the bread that they give you.

I've gone back again recently because I was craving the kabobs.

The place beats any Greek kabob, or any kabob really, by a long shot.
author: Thomas C.

description: I was a little leery of an Afghan restaurant that calls their bread "Afghani bread" (the afghani is the currency, "Afghan" references the nationality) but at the end of the day the food was really good. Had the steak kebabs and they were cooked perfectly, with really delicious seasoning. I ordered delivery and it was a little cold, but that's just the nature of the beast I guess. Good food in generous portions at San Francisco prices.
author: Kyle P.

description:
The place serves halal food.

We had chapli, lamb, beef kababs and kabuli pulao. All the items were delicious. The firni and sheer yakh (ice cream) were damn good as well.
The service was great.
author: Benson S.

description:
Decided to try out this place in my work neighborhood after hearing about it from several people. I decided to meet up with a friend for lunch and try it out. 

I ordered the Tri-tip kabob platter which came with rice. The rice was simply perfect and the meat was very tender. I loved the jalapenos on the side, they pleased this spicy food lover off the bat. The cilantro sauce that they serve on the table was very flavorful. 

I was very pleased with the service, quality of food and will be back to try more dishes.
author: Rebekah T.

description: One of the best kabobs I had in the long time. Not cheap but very good quality. Highly recommend for meat lovers.
author: Igt P.

description:
The best afghan food I've ever had!

My husband and I love to try foods from different cultures and sometimes it's not a great experience. We have had afghan food many times and never really loved it. Nevertheless, I wanted to give this place a try considering the rave reviews on yelp. 

We weren't really that hungry so we decided to order one plate and share it. We got the combination kebob plate which came with three pieces of chicken kebob, three pieces of beef kebob, rice, salad, and few small pieces of bread. My husband substituted the regular rice for qabuli pullow. 

The beef quality was excellent (juicy and tender) and the chicken was cooked to perfection. I could taste the smokey-ness in the chicken from the fresh BBQ. The qabuli pullow was delicious and had plenty of raisins in it to please the both of us. We were ready for seconds after we killed this plate in 2 minutes. 

If you want excellent and authentic afghan food, please try this!!!
author: Rubab M.

description: Excellent place.  Instead of kabobs which you can get anywhere. Go for their specials . Those are superb and unique.
author: Vlad K.

description: The food here is delicious. If you've never had Afghan food, you're in for a treat. I recommend a dish called, "Quabili Pallow." It's lamb shank served with seasoned rice, and topped with raisins and carrots. I could eat this every day--it's that good!
author: David R.

description:
Love Afgani kabobs & I am happy there's finally a nice one in SF. Me & my roomie had lunch & he wanted to back in 2 days. Awesome fresh Bolanis! Tried the Chicken kabobs & Chicken Korma. And their Ferni(dessert). Yummy! 
Will go back again. Totally recommend to those who make an entry to the Spice World.
author: Shahul H.

description:
Holy smokes! Why has it taken me SO long to find this place!!

Now that I know about this place there is definitely NO turning back. I think I'm in LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!

In a perfect location on Geary Street near bars, shops and bus lines. Came here with a couple friends during the evening  and instantly noticed that it's a small restaurant but the wait wasn't that long at all.

Once seated we all agreed on the appetizer of Bolani w/ potato, leeks & homemade yogurt sauce. One word to describe it..DELICIOUS! It was a lot but trusts me it didn't last long.

The complimentary bread was amazingly good and was even better when you put some of that good ol' Cilantro Chutney sauce on it! Yumm..makes my mouth watery just thinking about it.

For my main course meal I ordered: combination kabob (chicken and tekka beef) and I was truly happy with my decision. May I just state that I devoured my food! Like really? I took my plate DOWN! You would have thought it was my last meal I was living for. You can tell that the meat was marinated for a while because of how juice, moist and flavorful it was! OMG, my belly and I was in food heaven.

Then to top it off, our lovely server brought out Baklava which was on the house and let me say it was "a must get". The best way to top off the delicious meal and come down from our food high! 

Prices are very reasonable and the portions are enough for 1-2 people. I only ended up paying $20 in total for my appetizer and meal. NOT BAD! 

Customer Service was extremely nice and pleasant! He was constantly checking in on us and making sure we were satisfied. Plus we got FREE desert. Come on now, what more can I ask for?

I can't believe that it has taken me SO long to come here! I definitely will be back sooner than later. Don't wait....Bookmark this place and try it!
author: Porsche C.

description:
Food:
-Qabili Pallow was above-average, the versions from Helmand Palace or Kabul comes with better overall flavors
-Chicken kabob tasted standard
-Lamb kabob was too gamey
-Well seasoned rice with all the dishes
-Milk chai was too sweet

Service:
-Two servers for a Saturday night is busy but not short-staffed for the small restaurant, and is no excuse for terribly inattentive service.
-I was never able to make eye contact with one of the servers to get his attention for any request as he walked back and forth with a perpetual tunnel-vision and never bothered to check on our table.
-I get that life happens and you can't always carry a smile on your face, but you could manage that appropriately especially in a people-facing environment by taking some necessary breaks or work out something with the managers. That said, the aforementioned server also had the most miserable expression on his face the entire time and it felt like I was dining with Eeyore by my side.

Overall, very disappointed after seeing all the reviews. I'd recommend Helmand Palace nearby for better food, service, and ambiance.
author: Tian Q.

description: This place is *so* good, and one of my staples in the city. I don't even like beef generally, but love their chaplee kabob. Also, the bread that they have that's stuffed with pumpkin or potato. Also, the side dishes are yum. The service is spot on as well!
author: Diana C.

description:
Food - 5 stars
Customer service 4 stars 
The best afghani good I have ever had in US so far hands down. We were accommodated even though it was overflowing but in doing so they pissed other customers, who left threatening to leave bad reviews on yelp. When I got bill there was charge of 16$and on asking what it was for , I was told it was for accommodating us. Well that was a first one , never heard accommodation fees before. Even then I gave the guy 20% gratuity on top of that because I am khan & I always pay my debts :) 
Highly recommend to try the food and will recommend the owners to notify customers who are accommodated that there will be accommodation charges .
author: Habib K.

description:
Nice and calm welcome greetings.

We ordered mixed lamb and chicken platter, the meats were tender and juicy given the big chunks.
Rice was fragrant, salsa very fresh and the bread was delicious. Both my boyfriend and I enjoyed it alot. 
It is $14.95 though, not sure about the rates of Afghan food in San Francisco though, will try at more places to compare the value.
 
Overall, we like it alot and think this place serves very delicious and naturally flavoured foods.
Thumbs up
author: Am T.

description: Great Afghan cuisine (think of it as akin to Persian/Iranian cuisine but with some Indian and Central Asian influences) in a chill, clean setting with great service. The dishes are flavorful but not heavy/fatty at all. Try the mantoo and definitely share dishes with friends. I recommend pairing a savory meat dish with some great vegetable dishes. Don't be afraid to ask for recommendations.
author: Omar M.

description: The best tri-tip -- oh lord. Ordered Sabzi with bread as an app which I could have eaten happily all night long. Excellent portion size and super fresh and flavorful. The Tri-Tip Kebab was probably the best kebab I've ever had an one of the best pieces of grilled beef I've ever enjoyed. YUM!
author: Jasmine W.

description:
Excellent service! Haris is awesome 
Excellent food! You will wipe the plate clean

Will def come again
author: fahad u.

description: This place is great for a casual sit down or takeout.  I've eaten here regularly for a few years now (every month or so), and the quality is consistently good. I frequently get the triple kabob with a side or two and eat it for two meals.
author: Hannah F.

description: This restaurant became our family must place whenever we visit our north Cal family. We all like lamb kabobs here and it's must ordered item, even though my wife never liked lambs before. Now she does!
author: Sam S.

description: The chicken Korma with pallow rice was delicious! The chimichurri sauce is the best I've ever had! I could put it on everything!!
author: Mallory B.

description:
YUM! I have been here a handful of times, and service/good is always consistent. We usually start with the Bolani. It's kind of like a potato pancake and is super delicious paired with the sauces provided on the side. The chicken and beef kabob dishes are so so good and juicy! Never dry! They come with sides of rice, potato salad, a tomato/onion salad, and some bread. 

The place itself is pretty small, but well worth the wait.
author: Gina P.

description: Halal afghan place in near downtown is afghan kabob house . I ordered for pick ui . This lamb shank was excellent cooked . Great quality of rice .
author: Saeed A.

description: Really loved the lamb shank over rice. Delicious! First time having afghan food. Will definitely be back!
author: Victoria H.

description: This was our second visit to De Afghanan. The first sparked an obsession with Afghani food. We aren't locals, so the fact that we came back on our second trip to San Fran should say a lot. We had the combo platter (my super picky child agreed that we should visit this restaurant again on this trip) and also the rice with lamb. Was not left disappointed. Extra points for the super friendly staff.
author: D T.

description: Branch of the Fremont De Afghan. Food is great, just like the Fremont location. pretty slow service and tough parking (TL) because its in SF. The restaurant is much smaller but there was no wait when we went
author: Mason L.

description: Hands down this Afghan Restaurant serves the best Afghan food, I'm an Afghan and I know my food. I can have breakfast, lunch and dinner at this spot.
author: Z H.

description:
My friends and I came here on a busy Saturday night, right around dinner rush. We had heard the hype and decided to see for ourselves. The place is small (only around ten small tables or so), and the let us know that the wait would be around an hour. I think it was well worth the wait, and my friends thought so too.

Food was amazing! We ordered the Borani Kadoo (pumpkin appetizer) and Mantoo (meat dumplings) to start. The pumpkin was so good, it pretty much melted in your mouth. A must try. For entrees, we shared the Chicken Qorma (curry) and Triple Kebab (tekka beef, chicken, and chaplee). The curry was a little spicy for me, but I ordered the Dogh (yogurt drink), which cut through the spice very well. The meat in the kebab combo was super tender and juicy, not dried out at all. If you try anything here, that Sheer Yakh (Afghan ice cream) is to die for! We also ordered the Firni (milk pudding), which was delicious as well. I don't have much of a sweet tooth, but I couldn't get enough of their desserts.

As I mentioned, the inside is very small and it's a bit tight if you're standing there waiting. My friend also noted that the American flag was hung the wrong way according to flag rules. Minor details. Service was mediocre throughout the meal. For example, they took a while with the drinks and they were not very attentive. I think some people got complimentary bread, but our table didn't. Not sure if this was because of the food we ordered or what. However, our waitress did an outstanding job of recommending dishes to us, so I think we'll be back, perhaps on a slower night.
author: Eryn H.

description: The food is good, sometimes. Sometimes they're very good, sometimes the opposite. The food is very pricey, so I think they should try to control the quality better. The service isn't great at all, so I usually ask for delivery. Delivery is good.
author: Ramin A.

description: This was the best food I have ever had delivered to a hotel room. And that is saying a lot!! The combination kebab arrived hot and my special request not to include rice and bread was met with a beautifully prepared salad. the meat was tender and flavorful and the salad was cool and refreshing. What a nice surprise!!
author: Denise F.

description: This is my first experience dining in an afgan restaurant. They have very minimal menu, probably around 6-8 dishes. And boy, what an amazing food. I am a big fan of curries, kebab and tandoori food coming from an Indian background. I ordered chicken korma. It came with rice, bread and green chutney(read sauce) on the side. If you like various variety in curries and kebab, definitely give it a try.
author: Rahul G.

description: . I love kabob and I decided to give it a shot during lunch time at this place. I chose the tripe kabob dish they have. Awesome! Very tasty, with three different option of meat. I paid around 30 dollars in a very generous to go portion. The server was nice, even though I did not eat there, brought me a glass of water while I waited. My wait was about 15 minutes. I am definitely coming back another time!
author: Maria Izabel A.

description: I don't want anyone to know my favorite spot in the city. Wida - you are amazing and I love this place.
author: Conor M.

description:
Food is good but service is AWFUL and incompetent. 

Went for lunch with my husband today and felt totally disrespected. Ordered a kabob and lamb shank. Kabob came out first and we were almost done eating it and the lamb shank still hadn't arrived.

Three lamb shanks then arrive at the table behind us who had sat down and ordered about 10 minutes after us. Server then comes over and says they ran out of lamb shanks and would we want anything else. I ask how they ran out when we ordered first yet the table behind us somehow got 3 a second ago? He then back pedals and says they ordered a third one last minute and he accidentally gave them the last one instead of us so its his fault.

No apology or offer to comp us a different dish. I just shook my head and said no I didn't want anything else, I had wanted to try that dish. He then goes back to the other table and basically grabs one of the lamb shanks and tries to give it to me but it had been sitting on their table. I refuse and then he brings it back to their table. 

Really bad service and I'm pretty sure this violates health code. Earlier in the meal he had dropped two kabobs at another table and the chef asks him if it was table 5. He goes back and checks the ticket, realizes his mistake and then removes the plates and takes them to the right table! 

This was our second visit and had liked the food here but with service like this not planning to return. Luckily Helmand Place also serves Afghan food further down on Van Ness so will plan on going there instead.
author: Allison R.

description:
*** In Short ***

Tasty, flavorful, tender meat dishes!

*** In Depth ***

I'm sorry you were our second choice De Afghanan, but we really wanted to go to a restaurant I no longer remember the name of! Fortunately, they were closed for some national holiday of theirs, so we ended up coming here and trying their:

* Punpkin Bolina - We actually didn't order this, but some charitable gentleman gave us the rest of his, realizing this platter was far too large for one person to finish as an appetizer. That said, while the flavor and pan-frying was rather reminiscent of green onion pancakes, were were disappointed by how bland it was, even with the sauce.
