author: Cait W.

description:
I came here last week with my family for my sister's birthday. I thought it was nice, cozy restaurant and everyone left satisfied. This restaurant only has 12 tables or so and doesn't take reservations, but we were lucky enough to get a table for 5 on a Friday evening with no wait.

We started with the pumpkin bolani - flaky pancake with pumpkin stuffing and yogurt topping. It was okay. Definitely spicier than we expected!

Next, we tried the bread with spinach. Reminded me of naan and spinach curry.

I ordered the Qabili Pallow, which is a rice dish with a lamb shank, topped with carrots and raisins. It was flavorful and sweet!

But the real winner was the LAMB KABOB. So tender and juicy, and oh so good!
author: Anna L.

description:
Absolutely blown away by every single dish.
Had the:
-pumpkin appetizer
-mantu dumplings
-lamb shank and rice

Everything was flavorful and not greasy or overly seasoned. The bread is delicious and perfect for cleaning up every corner of your plate. The mint and yogurt flavors on the food are perfectly light and healthy tasting. They also have a very smart menu by having just a few options. Quality over quantity, unlike other restaurants that clutter their menu.

If you order what I had for two people, you will not be disappointed.
author: Jon T.

description:
There chaplee and chicken is always on point. I was apprehensive coming here just because their Fremont branch is their flagship restaurant. 
-1 star -their bolani is not as good and at times not fresh. 

Another thing I am not too happy with, is the rude man that answers the phone and stands in the kitchen. So glad he doesn't wait tables their waitress and waiter are wonderful though.
author: Anna J.

description: High five star. Ordered the combination beef and chicken kabob. Both were delicious and cooked just right. I love the spices. It comes with warm bread;white and brown long grain rice; and their chopped salad. The service was fantastic - the lady who assisted us was very nice. The place is clean but small - I like it like this since it's cozy . It located in the nicer area of Geary close to VanNess Avenue. Of course this is the city so parking is an adventure. The price is reasonable. Again the food is very delicious and I can tell that the preparation is clean.
author: Nixon L.

description: I seen this place many time but always forgot about it until I was waiting for the bus. Finally I remembered about it and went in. Wow, I can't believe I waited so long. The portions are big and the food is amazing! I've had the lamb plate as well as the chicken and beef kabobs and steak patty. And if you like spicy they have awesome red and green chili sauces. I've even ordered deliver, score!
author: A C.

description:
Self service.

Namesake is four or five stars. The chunks of marinated chicken breast were deliciously excellent. Includes rice and Afghani bread. Super reasonable $12 price.

If only the service was as good. Our waters were not filled, dessert was not offered and there was significant lag between menus/ordering and finished/check.

Small space didn't prevent with good conversation. But just know you might end up being mentioned in Leah Garchik's eavesdropping: http://www.sfgate.com/columnists/garchik/

Lots of potential. Lots of service misfires.
author: Jason B.

description:
This place is probably my favorite SF food find of the past few months.  I feel THINGS when I think about my meals here. 

JUST WOW.  Hands down, the best rice platter I've had in SF.  The combo kebab rice plate is absolutely heavenly.  I love how DELICOUS and tender the kabob meat (lamb and chicken) is! The rice is the absolute best and the cool thing is a rice plate comes with two different color rices.  I can't even deal.
author: Mia F.

description: This was just ok. Typically I go to Helmand Palace for Afghan cuisine. A friend recommended this new-ish spot, so I thought I would give it a try. I would say the options for vegetarians is much more limited than Helmand. The bolani was tasty, but the kadoo had a strange neon coloring. I'm no expert, but is that normal? My sister had the combination kabob and said it was undercooked for her liking. We heard the table next to us ordering theirs well-done. Maybe that's the way to go. The price also seemed really high for what it was. It's an easy choice for me: Helmand Palace every time.
author: Naomi W.

description:
DINNER REVIEW:
Definite fan. Seen it from the 38 bus stop for a while and been wanting to try it. 

FOOD:

Solid, laid back dishes with lots of sides and generous portions. I had the Tekka Kebab with a side of yogurt. She had the chicken kebab. The meat was amazingly juicy, how they got it that tender I may never know. Meat portions weren't huge, but there was plenty of other sides provided to mostly make up for it. Would suggest ordering a yogurt to eat with your meal.

ENVIRONMENT:

Clean, neat, and wonderful smelling inside. Nothing fancy, but real cozy feeling. 

SERVICE:

Professional and fast. Everyone who worked there seemed to know their job and focus on it well. Waitress was friendly, quick and courteous. 

SUMMARY:

Only missing that star because it lacked that "drunk from eating" feeling you get from a 5 star restaurant. Thanks Miles for pointing out my need for clarification.
author: Patrick T.

description: not the small take-out hole like in fremont...higher prices at over $43 total for 2...actual restaurant atmosphere...lamb kabob is excellent...tender juicy bites of meat...pumpkin pancakes great and toasty...soft sweet center...spinach is creamed and good
author: Hen A.

description: Has the best kabab, tea and baklava of San Francisco and the food is really priced low, based on its taste, location and ambiance. I would truly recommend this place for any meat lover, its heaven for kabab lovers!
author: Sarmistha C.

description: Lamb kabob is superb here. Check the photo, yum! The lamb chops are juicy which makes this restaurant stand out from others. I had Lamb Kabob twice and the taste was same (perfect!). I like everything about this place except for the price range. So, I do visit such places but not too often. Definitely, you can try for a birthday party. It's on Geary next to South Van ness and so, you are bound to get street parking. Anyways, I love it!
author: Pratik J.

description: Nice nice little afghani shop in a less nasty area of the tenderloin. Food is delicious and can be made as spicy as you want with that little green chutney you see in the main image. Definitely a solid choice when it comes to a divey food craving.
author: Ali H.

description:
I'm Afghan, so this review should mean a lot. 

Originally being from SoCal meant that my family always enjoyed our NorCal trips and the highlight was always getting good Afghan food at De Afghanan at their original hole in the wall location in Fremont. 

Service is excellent, the server/waitress was extremely nice and genuine reflecting true Afghan hospitality. 

Food is great, ordered of course the Bolani and than got the combo kabob plate to split with my friend who's first time it was trying Afghan food at a restaurant. They all tasted great, very fresh and flavorful. Although it might not be the best, but it's great start to have a legendary Afghan restaurant right here in San Francisco (I'm not sure how I feel about Helmand Palace) 

So if you want delicious food, that's similar to a Afghan home cooked meal, def do try this place. 

Oh I cannot forgot about the desserts, love the Falooda ( ice cream with heavy cream and pistachio topping and some rose water and rice noodles i believe) and the Firinee (pudding) 

and do get Tea to have with Dessert, love Afghan tea.
author: Amien P.

description:
The food is awesome. We came with a group, because it was marked as being good for groups, but really, don't come with more than four people. We were able to get a bit lucky, and merge two tables together to seat 6, but that might be pushing it.

They do not serve alcohol, but the server said BYOB is fine.

The dish that was least eaten was probably the Quabili Pallow (lamb shank). All the others were excellent. We ordered Bodinjon, and it was quickly eaten. Our group universally liked the Lamb Kabob, and nothing was left of it. The Sabzi Challow is similar to saag in Indian food - if you like saag, you'll like the sabzi.

At the end, we were all stuffed, and after tip, was around $27 / person. I definitely plan to come back.
author: C S.

description: What a great surprise to find this restaurant around the corner from AMC movie theaters. Every single dish was a home run. The bolani appetizer with potatoes was particularly memorable. My sweet chai tea, too, was addictively good. This was not the first time I tried Afghan food. But it was the first time I have been really excited by Afghan food. I am now, officially, a fan.
author: Morris R.

description: Can't believe we found such a nice place offering fabulous food! Must back again!!!! The price is very reasonable!!!
author: Chenhan Z.

description:
Came here for dinner last week with a group of friends. The inside was small but very clean and simple (in terms of decorations). My friend had commented he frequents their location in Fremont so he wanted to see how this new location stood the test. 
We ordered the bolani to share and i ordered the lamb kebob plate. My friend was nice enough to share a chaplee pattie with me too. Basically we devoured everything bolani, meats, rice - everything including ALL THE SAUCES. The green and red sauce both delicious and meats were cooked perfectly and seasoned. Delicious. Delicious. 
Never tried Afghan food - well me neither until this and I swear I had a food gasm here. Will be back!
Update: my friend took her afghan coworker here and def legit!
author: Julie F.

description:
Oh. My. God. Did they seriously open up De Afghanan in SF?!?!!? My life is officially complete. If you don't already know, let me break it down for you. De Afghanan is an Afghani restaurant that originated in Fremont and it is absolutely DELICIOUS. 

Must orders: 
- Chaplee Kabob (This is what they're known for) 
- Mantu (YUMMM!!!)

For non-beef eaters: 
- The chicken kabobs are seriously the best I've ever had
-Lamb (amazing) 

I started with the basket of Afghani bread paired with the green chutney for starters. The bolani is huge; be careful. Don't fill yourself up with the starters because the real deal at this restaurant is the meat. However, I am disappointed I didn't get the garbanzo beans/chutney mixture that everyone claimed they got for free? I also got the Afghani Vanilla Ice Cream/Pistachio mixture which was pretty good. 

Overall, couldn't be happier that this place finally made its way to San Francisco. The area in which the new location opened is surrounded by various Mediterranean/Turkish/Persian restaurants within walking distance and having been to ALL I think this one tops the charts!!!
author: Tina J.

description:
This place is downright wonderful.  A small ethnic hole-in-the- wall on a dreary stretch of Geary street, the kabob house is worth seeking out.  The place is clean; the food is very, very good; and the price is right.  And the people who run the place are proud of what they are doing, as well they might be.  

To start my meal, my server brought a chickpea/potato salad that was adrift in a spicy green sauce.  One taste of this meal starter, that came gratis, announced that whoever is in the kitchen knows spicing and doesn't pull his punches.  Great stuff.  

Next came my chicken, beef, chapli triple combination kabob plate.  Accompanying the perfectly prepared meats were white and brown rice, the latter tasting of cinnamon, a small well-seasoned salad, and some wonderfully crisp bread.  This plate was a complete meal for me; it had everything you could want and for under seventeen bucks it is a near-steal.  And by the way, the chapli is wonderful, leading me to suggest to my server that they should offer this as a sandwich.  It really is that good!

De Afghanistan Kabob House will certainly be on my regular rotation of restaurants.
author: David D.

description: This is the best kabob place in the city. I used to go to maykadeh but the service here is always so great and the food is always fresh and delicious!
author: Christy M.

description: This place is so amazing! Depending on what time you get there you might have to wait. This place is small and cozy but it's worth the wait! Service is great and food is outstanding! I love the Bolani, Lamb Kebab (tikka) and the Chapli Kebab which are real authentic Chapli kebab!!! Love that it comes with rice and a little portion of cucumber/onion/tomato mix! I would come here once a week if I lived nearby :)
author: Rabia K.

description:
This location is not as good as De Afghanan in Fremont. A very small restaurant with a limited menu. 

I ordered the roasted squash (kado borani) but they said they ran out (on a Sat night at 7 pm). I really enjoyed the mushroom/spinach (sabzi challow) dish, it was light and had a lot of flavor, many herbs used. The eggplant and tomato dish (bodinjon borani) was not to my liking because it had too oily, had too much acid from the tomatoes and heat from the chiles. 

We ordered food for two and only one meal was brought out but without any bread or rice. It took another 20 minutes to get the bread/rice and the food was cold by then. No water was given or offered. 

The vegetarian food comes in very small portions, and in general they are lacking vegetarian options. When I am in SF and want Afghani food, I will stick with eating at Helmand Palace.

Gluten notes: Most Afghani food is gluten free - just don't eat the bolani (bread) and order a side of rice.
author: Shannon Z.

description:
I could not be more excited that De Afghanan has moved to SF!! Used to go to this place all the time whenever I was in Berkeley, so I am thrilled that they are now in the city. 

Favorites include the Chaplee Kabob, The Teka Kabob, the Mantu, and the eggplant dish (can't remember what it is called...). Food is deliciously flavorful and full of spices, and portions are great. Haven't physically dined in at this location yet - we usually pick up dinner on the way home, and the food has always been ready on time.
author: Yishian Y.

description: The kabobs are the best i have ever had. Tender, juicy and flavorful. Service is good. Korma was not so good but it is probably not what you order at an Afghani restaurant. Great place!
author: Prabal T.

description: I drop in here atleast once a month. Their chaplee kabob and lamb shank are to die for.
author: Bennet M.

description:
I was literally driving by thinking in my head about dinner options and then I made a huge circle to park right in front and just HAD to try it! 

Now, I have never heard of this place or how popular it was all over the East Bay but WOW! It was REALLLYY GOOD!!! 

Had the Chap Lee Kebab, Chicken Kebab and some eggplant dip thing(starts with a "D") and they were ALL amazzziiiinngggg!!! Fresh flavours and just flat out yummy and hearty food. Nice BIG portions too, very filling and one entree shall suit a big eater like myself


Everybody there was super friendly too and really passionate about serving good food. The owner(I think) was going on about how much this is a labor of love and how much she cares about her business and I will definitely return.

Decor is not bad either, nice paintings, nice for a simple date or just a nice quick but super yummy dinner. Looks like a hole in the wall on the outside but inside is unexpected and I left a pretty shitty tip where they didn't seem to care so I must go back soon and take care of em! 

Great job guys, keep up the good work!! :)
author: Hubert L.

description: Best food ever this is my 2nd time coming now but the food is amazing love the service and cant get any better than this
author: Michael S.

description:
I love this place, we definitely needed GOOD Afghan food in SF!!!

We started off with a bolani and chaplee Kebob order, totally recommend those dishes. My family and I greatly enjoyed the succulent Triple meat dish -the meat was very juiced with the right amount of spices! If Only I could make that magic happen in my own kitchen, I would be in heaven every day. Best part, the prices were beyond decent, we got 5 star quality food at a fraction of the price! Thanks De Afg. for coming to SF!!
author: Katera M.

description:
This being my first try at afghani food I have nothing to compare it to. But I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here. It's quite a hole in the wall, but the service was friendly and helpful, and what we thought was a quiet spot, quickly turned into a cozily crowded little restaurant shortly after we sat down.

My boyfriend and I split  the Bolani which was large, flaky, and delicious with a kick served with yogurt sauce. Then another vegetarian appetizer called Borani. Light flavorful stewed veggies, and then finished with the mixed kebab with chicken, beef, and something that resembled a sausage pancake with green onion. It came with white and brown basmati rice and a small cucumber and tomato salad. I enjoyed everything. Meat was tender, good portion sizes, and satisfied at the end.

If you like this type of cuisine, or are like us and in the mood for something new, I suggest giving it a try.
author: Natalie W.

description:
I didn't think I would rate this place 5 stars when I walked in! You know by now red walls are not my thing...however as soon as the food arrived it was a different story. This was 5th time in a row of faultless culinary experience in SF. I do not dish 5 stars all the time...honest. 

We ordered the bolani (feeds about 3-4 people, skip ordering more starters) bolani in a nutshell is lightly fried bread stuffed with leek and potatos ( to die for we packed extra for breakfast next morning). The chicken kabob aka chicken cubes were really moist and bursting with flavour. And finally qabili rice comes with a lamb shank and was totally devoured within 5 minutes. The service was efficient and really friendly, the waitress was more of a hostess, I don't know if she owned the place but it felt like it. Definitly the best Afghani food I have had never mind the red walls.
author: Nora B.

description: Really good. We got the lamb kabob and the chicken qorma and both were good...Waitress was really nice too.
author: Madison H.

description: Really nice spicy and flavorful food. The service is good and fast enough. It's also very reasonably priced! Must go for vegetarians!
author: Namrata J.

description: Had been meaning to come here for months and last week we finally did. My date got some kind of leg of lamb with raisin wild rice which we both loved. I had two appetizers, the borani kadoo and the garbanzo/potato shornakhod. The latter was unexpectedly really spicy which was a welcome surprise, while the pumpkin dish was much milder but equally delicious. The pumpkin dish also came with Afghani bread which I would definitely recommend getting on the side if it doesn't come with any of your dishes! As for service, food was served lighting fast but waters were not refilled during the meal.
author: Audrey S.

description: Amazing!  Strolled in here after walking by, definitely glad I did.  Lamb kabob was absolutely fantastic.  Great little place for dinner!
author: Greg S.

description:
This place is awesome. I got several things on the menu--the kebabs were tender and flavorful and the bolani was delicious. Bolani kind of reminds me of an Indian parantha--it's a thin, layered flatbread stuffed with a salty potato or spinach filling.

The service was relatively fast and the actual restaurant is small but homely. It could be a cute place for a date if you aren't looking for the quintessential Italian joint. 


Plus points for the amazing bronze 3-D wall hanging of the famous Afghan girl's portrait from Nat Geo!
author: Dhwani T.

description:
Good Lord. This place is good. Small space, great for convos bc you can hear your friends/date speak without straining your ears. Low lighting so your friends/dates will look better, too. (jk)

I went on a Tuesday at 8:30 and every table (all eight of them lol) were full. 

Now for the good part...I ordered a vegetarian dish ~ Bodinjon Borani (roasted eggplant w/ garlic yogurt & dry mint) and it was incredibly fresh and delicious. Not to mention it was prepared within minutes, probably because it was a vegetarian dish. 

I have plans for sushi with a friend this Saturday, but I will be taking him here instead.
author: LV B.

description: First time here, food is delicious, just tried the Triple Kabob. Next time I'd spare the Chicken as it was dry to my taste and ask for Lamb or Chaplee (my favorite). Kabob took longer than expected for a semi empty place but it was definitely worth the wait. Would come back.
author: Ricardo S.

description: This place has some great food. I live in Los Angeles and am use to having Persian food, but never Afghan food. I decided to try this place out and am in love. I hope they open up a branch down here in LA. A must try for anyone who loves good food!
author: Kris M.

description:
Glad to try qabili lamb shank dish and the chaplee kabob so flavorful.

The rice was a welcome treat and loved the texture and fragrance.

My first afghan experience is definitely a keeper
author: Nelce S.

description: We had heard of this little Afghan eatery but came by once or twice at the wrong time.  After an enjoyable movie around the corner at the AMC, at 6:30pm on a Saturday night, we indulged in the dishes praised by other 5-star rating customers.  Dishes were indeed 'not greasy or overly seasoned..'  Hey, do go for the pumpkin bolani appetizer & the tri-tip kabob, w/ homemade yogurt.  Ditto the well prepared specialty entrees. Baklava dessert was nicely light & warm.  Our pleasant, courteous waiter assumed a museum docent role for a few minutes & provided us with a historical & cultural orientation to themes in a painting of Afghan life & sports.  Are we planning to come again, as well as recommend De Afghanan Kabob House to other folks?  Wha'd'y'think?!? :)
author: Benjamin T.

description: Had eggplant appetizer, triple kabob plate, chicken qorma and baklava for dessert.  Amazing.
author: Sylvia F.

description: The kabob plates are so great here that I can't say anything better about this place. The service is decent, it's smaller than normal, but the chicken and the Chaplee kabob is super spiced well.
author: Rohan D.

description:
I had gone to their location in Berkeley and thought the sabzi was great, so spinachy and green! Well, looking at it in the daylight during a lunch takeout, I see it is full of green food coloring. This didn't sit well with my stomach.

Also, I was going to have lunch there but when I got there I decided for takeout because 1) there was a loud grinding noise going on for a while 2) when that stopped, I hear a family blaring their tablet with kid entertainment and then 3) that was overtaken by really loud music coming from the back.
author: Janet B.

description:
Not authentic afghani food..
I order bolani they put potatoes with green onions which suppose to be potatoes with leaks..
Shornakod - was potatoes with garbanzo beans  in chutney sauce.
 Eggplant was roasted and then they put can tomato sauce on it with yogurt. 
Horrible horrible.. I'm sure the people who never had real afghani food will like it.. 

They will bring all the food together appetizer, main dish..etc so you can eat it fast and leave.

We got the main dish first then appetizer and same thing happen to one table next to us.. When they start complaining the manager told them it's their fault for not telling the waiter to bring appetizer first.. I was like what.. Really????? I never been to restaurant and tell them I want the appetizer first... 
their service was just horrible not sure if it was the owner or manager he was very very rude.. People like him should not be in customer service business..
author: Jasmin P.

description:
Working in town and staying next door at the Monarch Hotel I decided I needed some spice in my life. The food was pretty damn good. It wasn't spicy hot but was very flavorful. I got the vegetarian eggplant and peppers in a tomato sauce drizzled  with yogurt and mint. It came with basmati rice and Afghan bread. I ordered an appetizer called Bolani. It's like a tortilla filled with potatoes and leeks and it is served with yogurt and mint too. On the table was a little dish with some mint chutney very similar to Indian mint chutney that I ate with everything. It was very very good. I used the Afghan bread to sop up all the sauce and practically licked the plate clean. 

The restaurant is very unassuming. Without the sign outside you wouldn't even know it was there. It's small but cozy and the lady who helped me was very sweet. There was a noisy group in there eating in the corner and it was interesting to eves drop on the one girl who used to be a vegetarian even though she hates most things vegetarians love like cheese and avocado. She eventually became anemic and went back to eating meat. She didn't even know why she tried being a vegetarian when she hates most vegetarian staples. 

I would definitely eat here again. The prices for the portion size are a little high but when you're traveling in San Francisco you expect to pay a little more. I wouldn't go out of my way but if you are in the area it's a very good option and very different from all the sushi in the area.
author: Dustin S.

description: Excellent place for authentic Afghan food!!! Food is amazing and fresh. Very nice people and clean establishment. A must to visit when in the city
author: Habib S.

description:
I visited this place after going to the AMC cinema at Van Ness - it's just around the corner. Didn't feel like having fast food at Mel's Drive-In, and stumbled upon this unassuming gem.

The food is delicious and the portions are a fairly generous size; my friend and I split the lamb dish between us, which was enough food, along with the bread (although I wasn't particularly hungry, so probably would have managed my own portion otherwise). 

The decor isn't fancy and has more of a family-ish feel. There are paintings of Afghanistan on the walls. Would be perfect for a casual date, but nothing too dressy.
author: Kira G.

description:
My partner and I came here before the end of Ramadan. It was an amazing sight to see people gather around, order their food, and wait until it was time that they could finally break their fast. This, coupled with many of the paintings that depict images of what has and is going on in Afghanistan, really puts things into perspective. It was just an amazing intercultural and interfaith exchange going on that I observed and enjoyed seeing take place. 

Anyways, on to the food. I had their beef and chicken kabob combo. It was by far some of the best meat I've ever eaten in my life. The food was completely soul filling. I walked out wanting to eat more, though knowing my stomach didn't have enough space to fit any more contents in it. 

Definitely going back! Highly recommended!

Though it is worth noting that this place is quite small and can get crowded at times (and when rush hour picks, service can be severely slowed down due to lack of workers available - though you really see them doing their best, which shows how dedicated they are to providing the best they can with what they have).
author: Angelica R.

description:
This resraurant has a cozy atmosphere with cheap delicious food. The services was super nices and accommodated our requests.
Also they have delicious  salsas all house made! 
Highly recommen this gem in the tenderloin!
author: Irene C.

description: This place is awesome. I'm not an Afghani food expert but whatever they're doing is really good. I could eat the Cilantro Chutney they serve on every meal (It's somewhat similar to Chimichurri but so much better). We had the lamb shank and the Shami Kabob plate, it was more than enough food for two people. We also ordered the Pakaura appetizer and we were really happy they forgot about it because we were stuffed.
author: Ken S.

description: The food is excellent authentic Afghan cuisine. The staff are friendly and courteous. This is a great place to eat at reasonable prices.
author: Zak K.

description:
I wonder how they make meats so tender. .... must be using a lot of fat / oil in the marinade. 

Overall great food that's inexpensive too.
author: Ricky C.

description:
Checked this place out at my housemate's recommendation. Turned out to be quite good. Definitely try out the Bolani appetizer and the Dogh beverage. And if you REALLY have an appetite, go for the Triple Kabob platter.

I'd definitely be going back here to checkout the rest of the menu.

A word of advice: unless you are really used to spicy food, go for mild level of spicyness with the Bolani.
author: Anand S.

description: Hands down my favorite restaurant in the SF Bay Area. All of the dishes are phenomenal and are consistently delicious. The owners and staff are always friendly and accommodating. If you're into Afghan food or just expanding your horizons when it comes to great food, you're in luck!
author: Victoria G.

description: Best Afhan food I've had in a long time. Succulent chicken qorma, tender kabobs, great sauces. A shocking delight w/great service. Place is packed on Sat. nite. Come early.
author: Rob R.

description: Great food. One of the better kabab places I have eaten at. Chappli kabab was stellar. Its not a place where I would go for ambience, rather just for the food. Service was decent.
author: Nasheed M.

description:
Some friends and I had gone to the movies around the corner from this restaurant so at their suggestion we decided to drop in for dinner afterward.  We were seated right away but it was on the later side so that's probably why. Afterall, it's a small place with few tables. The decor is basic and nothing fancy but wow is the food delicious!

We ordered the pumpkin dish for an appetizer as well as the spinach & mushroom dish. They were both tasty.  For dinner we also shared the lamb and chicken dishes with basanti rice. The flavors were outstanding and the chicken dish was super moist. It melted in my mouth!  Also, the server will bring flatbread to the table but be sure and try the oregano sauce on it. Outstanding!

Our server was friendly and brought the dishes out right away. Again, it's not so much the decor and ambiance that people are apparently there for but the exceptional middle eastern flavors. 

I will definitely be back and look forward to trying the Baklava for dessert. We were too stuffed for it last time!
author: Rob L.

description:
Some of the best Afghan food I've ever had.

The mantu is freakin' amazing. And so is their lamb. 

You could point blindly at their menu and be happy with whatever you ended up ordering. SO GOOD.
author: Mira N.

description: Decided I am going to try and eat at a different establishment near my work for each meal over the next few weeks so I can get a taste of the area. Today I came here enticed by the idea of Afghani food, a cuisine I am not familiar with. There were a selection of appetizers including bolani, sabzi, and borani badenjan or kadoo. They had a number of enticing kabobs on the menu from beef to chicken to lamb. Their vegetarian option was badenjan challow, a sautéed eggplant with tomatoes, garlic, and peppers. I went with one of their specialty dishes, the chicken qorma: seasoned boneless chicken with tomatoes, sautéed onions, garlic, split peas, and spices. It was served with basmati rice and afghani bread. With the sides it made for a very filling meal and was very delicious. The chicken was tender and the spices were just right and not overpowering. The bread was really good and was great to dip in the extra sauce. They had a variety of afghani drinks as well, but I just went with water this time... There was so much food, I was already full. The service came from a young girl who was very polite and I feel like it might have been a family operation and she was related. It had a very homey feel to the place and was very intimate. A nice place for lunch (and probably dinner).
author: Roger M.

description: Ordered through yelp eats24 and guy at counter gave me a lot  attitude saying order needs to be confirmed before he prepares the meal.  I've ordered through eats24 countless times and I've never heard this before.  Now I am waiting outside for another 25 minutes in the cold.  I'll never comeback here again. Very rude and obnoxious.
author: Arsalan S.

description:
I was about to eat at Mel's diner on Van Ness when I found this place.  Tommy's was closed and Mel's is, well, Mel's.  Looking just past Mel's down Geary I could see the sign for this restaurant.  The sign was way too nice for where it was, so it got my attention and I walked in.  The restaurant is small and quiet.  It's very clean -- the owners really put some time and effort into this place.  I asked what they recommend, and my server recommended the triple kabob plate.  It took a little time -- about 15 minutes -- which I appreciated.  I took that as a sign that the food was not sitting around, but rather was prepared fresh.  Judging by the taste -- it definitely was freshly prepared.  I ate every bit.  

If you are going to the movies at the Van Ness AMC, consider this spot for dinner.  The neighborhood could use more like this one.
author: Michael B.

description: I can't wait to go back and try all the other menu items. Today was my first visit and I had the tri-tip kabobs which were hot and juicy and succulent! Melt in your mouth! Service was quick and friendly which is just what you need on your lunch hour. I really hope this little neighborhood gem succeeds!
author: Lou S.

description:
I grabbed a triple kabob to go.  Once I arrived home I thought this to be too much food.  OMG just like thanksgiving, I ate everything!  The kabob's both rices, the salad, the naan, everything in the container...

Perfectly seasoned, tender, tasty food!  Best Middle Eastern food Ive had since my time in the Middle East. . 

I'll be back with friends!
author: Walter H.

description: Went back after a long time and everything was awesome. Really loved the food and the service. The kabobs were done well.
author: Harry S.

description:
This place is fantastic! It's a nice small space with quality food! The staff is very friendly! I would easily recommend this to anyone of my friends! 
The sheer tea is fantastic, some of the best tea I have ever had. I had the lamb kabob for the main meal and it was so good and it easily filled me up! If I ever had to take friends out this would be one of my first choices!
author: Jacob J.

description: I went to this place on a whim. After (literally) taking an hour to drive about a mile, I was frustrated and needed something to help me relax. I was thinking a milkshake at Mel's diner just up the block, but was intrigued enough to give De Afghanan Kabob House a try. The Borani Bademjan - eggplant sauteed with fresh tomatoes, garlic and peppers topped with our homemade yogurt. that is served with afghan bread - was pretty phenomenal. It came out piping hot and redolent. The shornakhed that I was given as an amuse- a salad made of  garbanzo beans and potatoes with fresh herbs and spices - was also really delicious. I have to say their vegetarian options are topnotch. I wasn't too crazy about my teka beef kabob because It had a funky texture, and my chicken kabob was dry. Still, the marinade on the meat was good and the rice was tasty. The flavors were all authentic. The server, who is part of the family that runs this place, was really nice and the prices are very reasonable. It was a 4.5 out of 5 star dining experience for me. I would definitely try this place again. In fact, I am especially interested in trying the lamb.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Came here while on a short trip to San Fran and was in the mood for something spicy, this place did not disappoint

My date ordered Chicken Qorma and I got a Chicken Kabob, great combo for sharing. We both liked each other's dish so much we basically ended up switching plates. Chicken Qorma is a red sauce with chicken and chickpeas, great for dipping the Afghan bread, the seasoning on the chicken had a real nice kick to it. The chicken Kabob was also great, high quality and well seasoned. Also worth noting, the service was attentive and on point.

Hope we can find food like this when we head back home.
author: Jess A.

description: I am an afghan, but this was one of the worse experience I ever had. Customer service below zero, food not worth at all. The guy who was a waiter was completely unfamiliar of his job.... Worse
author: Hamed H.

description: I found this place because I used to work in the east bay and we would go to the location in Livermore. I even drove out to Livermore twice just to eat this amazing food. I was beyond excited to have a location pop up in SF. I'm always greeted with smiles and helpful service. Beyond that, I love the food so much. Recommend the chicken kabobs, Volans, and sabzi. A little spicy, but I love that. I will keep coming back and trying new dishes!
author: Ali G.

description: I didn't know the had a De Afghanan in the city. So I was really excite when I found one in the city. I ordered take out. Chicken tikka kabob plate. Every bit was juicy and full of flavor. I liked how this place gives u a combo rice white and brown. Adds a nice little touch.
author: Sonia D.

description: i live a few doors down and so i order take out every so often, and i love this place! always delicious and the service is great!
author: Shira T.

description: I read about this place in some article and a friend of mine came and said it was real good..so here I am eating some beef and chicken kabobs! The meats were so flavorful and moist! You need to get yogurt sauce to go with your kabob dish, it's so good! My friends and I shared the potato bolani which was good but I have to say the free bread we got tasted better than the bolani.  That free bread was perfection toasty flaky yummy chewy. What I didn't like the price was kinda high.  3 of us shared the bolani got a kabob dish each and it came out to $25 each that was including tip and tax. Well I guess it's not bad because of all the protein we got.
author: Karen T.

description:
This place is incredible.
I hate some helper with their lame reviews.
This is place is authentic and really delicious.
The staff are friendly hard working and super sweet.
If you want the best this is where you should absolutely check out & yes you will be hooked on the cuisine people & culture.
author: arzo n.

description: This place just keeps getting better! They have increased their standards further. My favorite item is the Chicken Kabob with the Dogh and the Phirni is just out of the world :)
author: Shikha P.

description:
My friends and I wanted to try this place after learning that their Fremont location was very popular.  The menu looked so great that we wanted to order everything, but maybe we were just super hungry.  

We decided on the four dishes, and we all agreed the beef kebabs and dumplings were dishes we'd order again.  It was a nice discovery for the an atypical cuisine in SF, and we all agreed we'd be back!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I had the Bolani, the triple kabob platter, and the ice cream while I was here. The waiter was friendly. The food was fresh, hot, and delicious (be forewarned though a lot of it is spicy, so if that's not your thing then be careful about what you order). I went during lunch and we had the benefit of being the only customers there. No, it's not a large place nor is it overly fancy or pretentious. It is a simple place with a small and edited menu. Overall the food was great and I will definitely be back. 

**great option for anyone looking for a neat restaurant near AMC 1000.
author: Arin V.

description: The kabobs are incredible with the chicken better than the beef as it's more tender. The basmati rice is delicious and I  think everyone should give this place a try at least once.
author: N A.

description: This was one of my favorite places when I lived in Fremont.  The MOST flavorful, tender and juicy meats I have ever had.  The rice that comes with the dishes is insane with taste.  I suggest you spring for the carrots and raisins which add more dimension and pairs so well with the chicken and beef.  I highly recommend the bolani, the leek and potato is my fave.  I'd describe as a Mexican Quesadilla, but instead of a flour tortilla it's a delicious pastry and instead of sour cream it's served with yogurt and cilantro chutney!  Deeeeeee-lish.  They also have hot sauce on be table which adds some serious heat to the dish if you so desire.  Their dishes are also served with a side dish, sometimes it's like a pico de gallo and other times I've been served a potato salad, which is so savory and acidic, you have to taste it to understand, divine!  It's a great place to go in and dine and or have it delivered.  Regardless, it's a must try!!
author: Gregory M.

description: The lamb shank is so good, it has ruined "food" for me for the rest of my life.
author: Tyler H.

description: OMG!!! The best meal I've had in a while! Had the triple combo and I usually have a small appetite, but I ate EVERYTHING!!! Chapli was super yummy, beef and chicken was cooked perfectly! Soo tender and full of delicious flavors! Definitely coming back here!!! Thanks to the wonderful chefs and great service for an excellent 1st time experience!
author: Melinda N.

description: Good food overall. Lamb kabab was especially the best, chicken and beef were good too. Small portions. They definitely over over charge for the portion they serve!! $$$
author: Kourosh N.

description: In town on business and this place is around the corner from my hotel. I've eaten there every night and will continue to. The kabobs are amazing. Salads, sides, spices, sauces and Afghan bread are spot on and amazingly affordable. Wish I could bring them home. I highly recommend these guys. A true gem.
author: Michael D.

description: I have had take out from here a couple times. They are excellent. Their kabobs are amazing, fresh, and their spices are complex and exciting. The aroma made me hungry. I had their triple kabob. Sirloin was well cooked, juicy and tender. Their chicken was spicy, but not overwhelming, perfectly cooked, tender and juicy. And their beef tikka was tasty, juicy and perfectly cooked. I have only had this dish, and well worth the price.
author: Dean N.

description: Oh my, it's really good. Get the vegetarian pumpkin dish, and the Afghan ice cream dessert.
author: John Lomax A.

description: This is definitely the best Afghan restaurant in the city. Their pumpkin appetizer is exactly what I was hoping for, a little sweet and a little garlicky...love it!
author: J. L.

description: If you're looking for authentic Afghan food, this is the place!  The Mantoo is a must have.  A glass of dogh with your meal is also very refreshing and I would certainly have some sheer yakh for dessert.  Absolutely delicious!
author: Massood K.

description:
Very nice meat, ))) loved it
We have an Afghan placebon Chicago, loved it there, loved it here. 
Recommend it to those who appreciate quality meat food, good rice
author: Ernest B.

description: Friendly staff, quiet and relaxing for a Friday night. Big portions: 3 of us shared a bolani, beef dumplings (my favorite - so divine and savory) and a kebab plate, which came with rice AND bread. We had to take 1/2 the bolani home and could barely finished the rest.
author: Dian R.

description: I have been to this restaurant for both lunch and dinner. Thus far I have been very impressed with the quality of the food. I recently tried a spinach dish that was simply amazing. The kabobs are delightful. The only down side is that there are no lunch specials so it can turn out to be a pricey lunch depending on what you order.
author: Sil L.

description: The food was pricey, thank god for business expense. I would say that having had good afghani food this can only get 3 stars. The service was average.
author: Khalid I.

description: This place is absolutely amazing. So glad I found it. The food is delicious and has so much flavor. The home made bread and green sauce are awesome. The sauce is spicy and minty and goes well on everything. I got the vegetarian eggplant dish and loved it. Service was great too. I highly highly recommend this place.
author: Elizabeth V.

description: This place is great.  This is the first time I had Afghan food and it was absolutely delicious.  The boyfriend and I shared the Eggplant appetizer and the Triple Kabob since we wanted to try all the meats.  The afghan bread was also really good with the appetizer and the green chutney that sits on every table.  It's right next to the AMC movie theater so we are here before the movie.
author: Victoria A.

description: Best Afghan food I have ever had. The Lamb Kabob has no match so does the service.
author: Abhijit P.

description:
This place has the best kabobs in San Francisco.  

I've had been going to their old Berkeley location for about 10 years - I've tried every kabob place in a 20 mile radius and they have the best out there.

New to De Afghan?  Get the Chicken Kabob or the Chaplee Kabob.

Nearly all of the menu is GLUTEN-FREE!  Just ask for no bread.  Everything on the menu is gluten-free except the Bolani, Mantu and bread. 

Thank you for the huge portions too!  You will not go home hungry.

And the service is down-home family run spectacular.

Thank you for moving this wonderful restaurant to SF!
author: Jaydee B.

description: Tasty and original, this place has a flavor all it's own.   My gf and I were the only non-Afghans in the restaurant, so perhaps this is authentic Afghani cuisine.  In any case, it is delicious and worth a try.  I look forward to venturing here again when I'm in the neighborhood.  The creamed veggie appetizers were very good.  The ice cream with Rose flavor is worth a taste...and you won't stop at just one taste!  Yum!
author: Zeus M.

description: Tucked between two buildings larger than this one and you might walk right by it if you aren't paying attention, good thing we were. We came here to grab a quick lunch before an appointment. The place is small but that's good because you can smell all the wonderful food coming from the kitchen. The decor was plain and simple but stayed true to the cuisine of the restaurant. We got the bolani which is like potato bread of some sort that you pair with a yogurt sauce which is on the tart side. I usually like it and I did here. Very savory dish and a great way to start the meal. Be careful not to eat too much or else you'll get full and wont' want to eat anything else. We then got borani which I think is what it was which is like a ravioli. It was okay but it was the same yogurt sauce and the meat had a little too much spice which was overpowering. We then got a mixed kebab plate and sometimes when you order chicken kabob it is dry, but not here. That's how you can usually gauge how well the other kabobs were cooked. If you can do chicken right, chances are you can get the other meats right too. They did and I was so happy. Moist, tender cuts of meat over rice with salad, I was scarfing everything. No leftovers for us. It's a nice little addition to the neighborhood. Check it out.
author: Jeromy G.

description: Cool place with good food, but our waiter hurried us out basically the moment we stopped eating. Would prefer to have more time to chat with my buddies next time.
author: Rewon C.

description: Very refreshing. Great Yelp recommendation.  Nice menu with not too many choices which means to me they focus on items.  Was delicious.  Cream spinach, chicken kabob and a cucumber drink, very tasty.  Very moderate prices and good service. Only 9 tables.  I give this place a deserved 5 stars.
author: Maxwell R.

description: Fantastic food, kababs are awesome, portions are very fulfilling and the price is very affordable.
author: Mehmet Efe A.

description: There is nothing in the bay area like de afghan for kabobs. I drive from berkley just to have kabob. Hate that they moved from berkley
author: Ravi V.

description: Not sure why this place has 4 and half stars, I am used to having amazing Mediterranean food in Los Angeles that this place is simply not that great. We decided to go here because we were craving kabobs, I ordered the chicken kabob and some curry, the kabobs were ok but the curry was cold ( we assumed that it was lightly heated up or microwaved). Service was ok not the best, we ordered tea and the tea was cold as well. If you love tea like I do, tea must be made with boiling hot water or else it doesn't taste that great. We were sadly disappointed
author: Sobashi W.

description:
Kabobs!
Kabobs!
Kabobs!

This place is fantabulous.  Their ability to perfectly cook a chicken kabob is absolutely astounding.  If I could, I would eat here 3x per week. 

They are probably on the quietest section of Geary, so if your driving bring some quarters - nearly always find metered parking out front.

Superb!
author: Joel Z.

description: Great service.  Food rocks.  Their tea hit he spot.  You need to try this place.
author: Edward V.

description: A great little afghan hole in the wall Resturant. The place isn't very big so it would be difficult to accommodate a large party. I ordered the mantu and the chicken kabob. The chicken plate was amazing! It came with both white rice and flavored rice, both were very good. The salad was mediocre. I've had better mantu but it definitely wasn't bad. The bread was excellent. I wish I had more room to try the boolani and eggplant. Maybe next time I'm in SF!
author: Asma w.

description: After a recent trip to their Fremont location, where I had quite possibly the best lamb kabob I've ever tasted, I was psyched to visit their spot in the Tenderloin. Primed and ready, I ordered the lamb kabob for takeout but was told they had just ran out. An Afghan place running out of lamb meat seemed pretty strange, like a taqueria running out of beans and tortillas, but I grudgingly went with chicken. For whatever reason they gave me beef, which turned out to be a fortunate mistake because it was delicious! My meal was packed with rice, meat, bread, sauces and an amazingly delicious side of chic peas. More than enough for lunch, I was stuffed, drowsy, and thoroughly unproductive the remainder of the day. Definitely looking forward to coming back for two of my favorite Afghan dishes,  lamb and kado!
author: Ryan S.

description: Good place, i go to their location in Fremont as well. Best Chaplee kabob my recommendation would me COmbo plate with Chicken and Chaplee Yummy!
author: S K.

description:
First, let me stipulate that the other reviews of De Afghanan Kabob House are accurate.

The place itself is a standard mom and pop ethnic restaurant, a little cleaner than usual, better ventilation, but standard nonetheless.

The food is undeniably tasty. I had the triple kabob, the spinach entree, and a cup of chai. Is it authentic? I wouldn't know.

So, why am I rating De Afghanan Kabob House a lowly three? In a word, the pricing.

The pricing formula is remarkably straightforward. The owners start with a price which is pushing the edge of reasonable and then add a 50% markup.

The "chai" was a teabag and some water -- for $3.50. Over the last few years, the San Francisco buying public has gotten used to paying the inflated price of $2.50 for a teabag. Think for a minute of what the profit margin is for a teabag.

The amount of spinach was reasonable -- for $6.99. It was priced at $9.99. 

The triple kabob was a fair amount of food. Two not very hungry friends could split it, along with the spinach and be satisfied. $13.99? Maybe. But no, it was $16.99.

You have to give it up to the owners of De Afghanan Kabob House. They are nothing if not consistent.

Why is De Afghanan Kabob House so pricey? Is it the greed of the owners, the greed of the landlord, or both? In defense of the owners, I should note that with rents for a one bedroom hitting $3000 as of this writing, I would bet a shiny quarter (what with inflation) that commercial rents are just as asinine. Maybe the owners of De Afghanan Kabob House are forced by market conditions to charge these insane prices.

All I know is the food, as good as it is, is curdling in my stomach as I write this.
author: Michael K.

description: Amazing food, good service, decently priced, and nice atmosphere. Those are the qualities that a good restaurant to me has and this restaurant filled all of those qualities. Although when we went we there were some noisy people, it was fine because the food was excellent. After the meal we ordered all 3 teas that they had, and it was so calming and good. Overall I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes good food and a good price.
author: Maira M.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in town. Home/family like atmosphere and very flavorful food (which I can't say about too many places in town). If you want to surprise a friend or a date with a non-mainstream place that serves food that will blow their mind, this is the spot. It's a bit more pricey than your typical middle eastern cafe, but it's well worth it.  Sauteed pumpkin is a must dish .
author: Arkady I.

description: Came here today for the first time with someone who had been before. It. Was. Delicious. The chicken and beef kebabs were both phenomenal, as was the flatbread and accompaniments. Will absolutely be coming again.
author: Tristan Z.

description: I tried this restaurant last week and the food here is very delicious. *****we tried the lamb kebob, teka kebob, dough drink, qabli palao (rice with fried raisins and carrots with a piece of lamb shank), and the borani banjan (eggplant). i would not order the eggplant dish again, but the main entrees were very good!!! would come back to try them again! comes with complimentary shor nakhood (garbanzo beans and potatoes with green chutney sauce), bread, and two kinds of hot sauces (red and green). five star for service and food.
author: Barikzai Z.

description: Yummy food. Service was fast and friendly. Our family of four shared the eggplant, the pumpkin, the lamb shank, and the Manitoo. We arrived at 5:30pm and the restaurant was empty. When we left 45 minutes later nearly every table was taken. I recommend the restaurant. Only hesitation was the food was a tad pricey for vegetarian fare.
author: Doug W.

description: Great food. Lamb shank was amazing - didn't think I could finish it; I finished it. Prices are best.
author: Sayan M.

description:
Good service, friendly, solid food. Good for in-restaurant dining, especially before a movie at the AMC around the corner, or good for takeout. 
Be pre-warned that there's no alcohol sold there.
author: Jeffrey H.

description:
I have tried Helmand's Palace and while the food is good, De Afghanan Kabob House beats it by a mile. The food was cooked to perfection, the service is perfect and the artwork on the walls tells the story of Afghanistan. It is a laid back restaurant but don't let that deter you. The food will make you happy. 

Always a good sign - when you find Afghanis eating there. 

Dine here. It will become one of your new favorites.
author: William N.

description: I love middle eastern food, and dinner here was tasty but not stellar like I read in some other reviews. I ordered the spiced pumpkin app ($7, really good) and the Chicken Qorma ($12, decent but wouldn't write home about it). It tasted authentic and on balance it was "pretty good". They only had one floor staff when I was there - and to be fair it's a tiny place so 2 might be overkill - but that meant somewhat slow service when it was getting busy. All that said, I'll probably grub here again every so often. Worth the initial trip if you like Afghan food.
author: Travis B.

description: Never had afghan food before coming to this place, wasnt sure what to expect except I saw something on food network where the dude at a piece of a goat or lambs head at the place in berkley.  Anyway it made me want to come here.   I liked the food, didnt have the lamb thing i saw on tv, but it was legit.  I remember the bread things reminded me of the asian onion pancakes.  Food was good, I liked it.
author: christopher h.

description: Everything was incredibly delicious and our server was very nice. I recommend the rose water ice cream for dessert.
author: Laef B.

description: Always a good experience. The chapee kebabs are nice and spicy. I got take away a couple of days ago and the food traveled well. I would recommend though that they add yogurt to their dinner meal to cut the spice level.
author: Vishal B.

description: Really tasty and cheap Afghani food. Have allready been here twice in a week and will come back soon.
author: Lana C.

description: Omg the Best Afghan food in Town! The lamb kabob...tender juicy cooked to perfection! Food and service awesome. I love this place and would recommend it to everyone!
author: Diem N.

description: Absolutley delicious!!  I went for dinner yesterday and I will definately be coming back next time I am in town.  I ordered the eggplant appetizer and the lamb kabob, which I recommend for anyone, even if they have never had Afghan food.  The appetizer is enough for two to split and the sauce used has a similar taste to a spicy marinara plus a good amount of eggplant. Now to the entree...what can I say, it was fantastic!  It comes with about eight good sized pieces of lamb that are really tender and juicy, which is what I loved the most because alot of other Afghan restaurants that I have been to always overcook theirs.  It also comes with two sides of rice and some diced onions and tomatoes. The place is small, but the food and service are great, which makes this establishment a must visit.  Also, I recommend taking a cab there as there are no nearby BART stations.
author: Ricardo S.

description: Went there for the first time with one of my good friends. I heard about the hype all the way down from Fremont. After being told there was a 45 min wait at the Fremont location I gave up and came back to the city. They recently open a nice convenient location close by my work in sf, and The food here is one the most unique an tasteful foods I've had in a while. True authentic Afghan food! The owners are extremely nice, the prices are little upscale but can be managed, but at the end your money is worth it! Chapli kabob is a must!!!! Can't wait to go back and try other dishes !
author: Usama S.

description: This place is high on flavor but low on hospitality. They could easily upgrade the venueand double the prices as the food supports it. However, its a uncomfortable dining experience with the smells of the tenderloin wafting in th open door and overpowering the aroma of the food.
author: Stephen H.

description: Bomb.com. food is great and super authentic. Owners take great care of you. Try it! You won't regret.
author: Parkin K.

description: Pretty decent and fresh ingredients. Would like to see a more expanded menu in the future.
author: Amy L.

description: This deafghanan delivers just like the rest! My husband and I have been here twice, excellent experience both times. The chicken, Chapli, and tikka kabob are flavorful and the rice is perfect! The service is top notch everyone is incredibly attentive and helpful. The dessert is also delightful and both times our waitress gave us green tea to end our meal.
author: Spozmai S.

description:
I'm an out-of-towner and I can't wait to come back to this place.  Everything is so flavorful, I enjoyed all the menu items we tried.

I absolutely CRAVE the cilantro chutney.  Delicious.
author: Arn H.

description: Amazing and tasty food plus outstanding service! Reasonable prices and easy parking on the weekends.
author: Beatriz F.

description: Delicious perfection! We got the bolani, combination kabob, quabili pallow, and Afghan ice cream. Fair disclosure: we're big Afghan food fans, and we've been to the other De Afghanan locations (the old place on Polk, Berkeley). This restaurant does not disappoint. The kabob we had last night was one of the best, if not THE best I've ever had. The kabob (beef & chicken) was juicy, tender, seasoned, browned- yum!  The quabli palau flavorful with a beautiful lamb shank. I wouldn't have changed a thing. Definitely the best Afghan food in the bay.
author: Reva B.

description: Great food and good service. Chicken and tekka Kebap so delicious. Icecream and rice pudding was tasteful. The most importantly you don't feel heavy after a heavy meal!
author: Arzu O.

description: I wasn't too hungry, so I got the aush, which is a noodle soup topped with ground beef, yogurt and dry mint.  Reminder... the menu says meat is optional, so if you order aush, you're getting it vegetarian, unless you mention "with meat".  What I got tasted like SpaghettiO's with frozen mixed veggies (peas, carrots, corn, green beans).  The soup was bland, not complex... the noodles were mushy... the drizzle of yogurt and sprinkle of dried mint disappeared, along with the flavor, when I stirred it.  Not to mention the druggy-filled streets I walked through to get here.  I don't know why this place got so many good reviews... perhaps, I took the wrong streets... maybe I ordered the wrong thing... whatever it is, I'm definitely going back to Helmand Palace for Afghan cuisine.
author: J T.

description: Popeye would have been four times as big if he ate spinach this good. And everything else is equally good (except perhaps the beef kebab which I would only give four stars). Great service too. Come, order too much and enjoy.
author: Rajash S.

description: Amazing Manto, chicken kabob, beef kabob and Chapli kabob!!!! Cute smaller restaurant with a warm ambience. Nice service provided by a very friendly staff. All items ordered were delicious  and food was served quickly. Very enjoyable.
author: Omar H.

description: Seems really busy.  Place seems kinda small.  The food is excellent!  Definitely the same flavors as its Fremont counterpart.  That is a very good thing since I live in the city.  No more long drives to fulfill the craving of amazing Afghan food.
author: Ahmed B.

description: Hands down, the best I have ever tasted! All the meats are delicious, I've only had dumplings as appetizer and was not disappointed.  A bit crowded since the place is small and business is great...a must try!
author: S S.

description: I ordered the chicken kabob and it was delicious! The chicken was tender and the food was fresh.  I ordered take-out.  The restaurant is small but the people working were friendly.  Definitely would go back.
author: James E.

description: I have been going to this place for years and this location just opened up, I cannot recommend one dish in this place since everything on their menu is on point. The service is also amazing in this location, if you do want to taste a little of all 3 different proteins ask for the 3eo.
author: Dave A.

description: I like! We tried the meat sampler because..it's a meat sampler. My favorite was the Shami Kabob which was ground beef studded with scallions and loaded with seasoning. It got a nice crust from the flattop. I was really happy about that. The garbanzo vinegary free app was a treat. Super friendly service. Will be back.
author: Anthony R.

description: Amazing food, perfect-sized menu, very friendly staff.
author: Brian L.

description: When we enter the door we were ask how many without even greetings whatsoever. And when I just asked the waiter a simple question by saying," what is the wait time?". and he was like if you don't like it you could go to mcdonald or any other restaurants. My wife and I were shocked by hearing that. So when he asked us are u guys ready we simply thanked him sarcastically for his mannerism and customer service. Don't eat here, the place smell like middle eatern farts and armpits. And extremely bad customer service. double thumbs down
author: Karl D.

description: The food was really delicious and the service was so fast. We had the potatoes and leek baloni which came out piping hot and was more than filling as an appetizer. We also had the lamb kabob platter and the triple meat platter. The rices were delish, as were the meats. I feel that the chicken and lamb were the most well received, but everything was delicious. The salad was the only problematic part. I could not eat it due to the extreme bitterness of the cilantro, but my partner enjoyed it. The service was great and friendly. And you gotta love the affordable prices. Definitely coming back!
author: Chelsea B.

description:
Amazing afghan. Best kabobs in the bay for sure. 

Tip: get the combo kabob with the qabuli pilau instead of the regular rice.
author: Muhammad M.

description: I've eaten here many times.  Their simple menu is consistently delicious, particularly the mouth-watering, well-seasoned chicken kabob.  Compares favorably to similar restaurants in the neighborhood.
author: Nicolas B.

description: This place is seriously good! Recommended by a friend of mine who knew their fame from their Fremont spot and that didn't disappoint us. When it comes to kebabs, i become super picky since i know the stuff but de afghanan is doing a great job with it also the place looks clean and simple.
author: Beril Y.

description: First place I visited when I came to SF. This was also the first time I was trying Afghani food. All I have to say is that the food was amazing. I had the beef kabob and the meat was cooked correctly and the rice is very unique and tasty. The portion sizes were also very filling. I also had a dessert which was ice-cream with crushed pistachios and rose water and that too was amazing. The place is small, so it's a artsy hole in the wall. Service was great and I saw a lot of locals come in which usually means it's a solid place. I highly recommend them.
author: Ammir V.

description: I work on union square and I have a million options for lunch. Had to walk 15 minutes to get here. It was worth it. The food was delicious and quick. Had the lamb dish. The meat literally melted off the bone. No gaminess. Also had the spinach appetizer was good but a tad salty. My friend had the chicken in red sauce. ( sorry not sure about the names) also was excellent.
author: Rami K.

description: I have been here many times. Being a big foodie, I can honestly say this place has quality food. They are consistent, and always eager to satisfy their customers. This is one of my favorite go to places in SF. The owner, Harris, is a very nice guy who values customer service, and food quality. My godmother and I really enjoy borani badenjan, combination kabob, and triple kabob. Their firni (dessert) is one of the best I have tried. My godmother and I are both looking forward to trying out other dishes De Afghanan Kabob House offers. Our dining experience last night was enjoyable. Thank you Harris and your staff for good customer service and delicious food...
author: Jasabel L.

description: Probably the best Afghani food I had EVER. I've been here many times and also to their Fremont location. The combination kebab and Kabuli Pulaw are fantastic. Any of the kebabs in the combination platter will be great. I don't usually like chicken kebabs but I get them here. Come hungry!
author: Faiz S.

description: Wow. I think this place ties with a spot in the Mission district as as my favorite middle-eastern restaurant in SF. We had the beef kabob, the spinach appetizer, and the potato pancake appetizer. The potato pancake appetizer, but I can do without it for my next visit. The spinach appetizer will definitely be a repeat in next visit. I'm coming back to try the lamb kabob and the pullao (may not spell that correctly).
author: Michael R.

description: This place is delicious, easy, and the staff is very nice. I picked up the wrong order (which was my fault, she asked if it was right and I just grabbed it) and they were super nice about replacing it and encouraged us to try the order we had gotten by accident. Awesome.
author: Rachel R.

description: Everything there was absolutely fantastic. The meats, the rice, the bread, the sauces, the tea. Each item simple on its own had flavors that were so delightful. Eat the bread as soon as it comes to your table. The flavor stays good as it cools but when it is first fresh and warm and soft it is like a warm grandmother. The red and green sauces are super good. I am so glad to have found this place and will be sure to return any time I am in town. Really be sure to try the spicy milk tea. It's so good.
author: Kenny M.

description:
The food here is *delicious*... worth the drive into the city just for their mantu.  Very flavorful food, cooked perfectly, no excess oils, and spiced just right.

Very engaging service.  5+ stars
author: Rick H.

description: Great quality always fresh taste really good i'm going there at least twice a week finally a great afghan  place in the city thank you guys so much and keep doing what you doing
author: Rotem F.

description:
Same here:] dinner before ACM. Took just about 1 hour to sit down, order, enjoy, and leave. Worked out well. 

I've not pick about food, but I hold a high standard for kebabs, having been Noon-o-kebab. We tried chicken, beef and lamb kebabs.  Lamb is the most impressive of all. They really got the spice right! Meat could be slightly more tender, but definitely above San Fran average, and absolutely beyond average dinner before movie ;]
author: Sans S.

description: Ridiculously good!! Forget what you think you know about kabobs and let these guys show you what afghan cuisine is all about.
author: Seth D.

description: Congratulations on your success--you deserve it--we miss you in Berkeley (Curtis street) oooxx emily
author: Emily K.

description: Amazing and delicious food. We came from San Diego and stop for a lunch. Clean, casual and small place with great food. The food was cooked and served fast. Meat was tender and delicious, rice was cook to perfection.
author: Tatiana G.

description: I've experienced more delicious and authentic Afghan food...the food is bland especially the rice. The manta and lamb were way too greasy. I think this place is too expensive for the quality of the food. The restaurant is also very small and customer service is bad.
author: Gi W.

description:
I was a regular at De Afghanan in Berkeley and always had a great experience at the restaurant.   I recently went to De Afghanan in SF and had a new male waiter.  He was extremely unfriendly, uncaring, overwhelmed, and rude.  We had to get our own menus, our own water after waiting for the waiter to pay some attention to us.  We then had to flag him down multiple times before he came to take our order.  After a long wait, we got our food.  The food was, as usual, delicious.  But, we then had to wait 30/40 minutes for him to run our credit card.  He only did it when we physically got up and stood over him to get him to run our cards so we could leave.  Extremely frustrating experience and beyond poor service.  

Despite the amazing food, I won't be able to go back due to the bad experiences with this waiter.
author: N B.

description: Absolutely delicious. Service was a little slow, but not due to lack of effort from their single waitress.
author: Robert S.

description: I went to this resturant with my family of 17 people , usually I would think restaurants would like big crowds because of the business but no we were treated bad we asked for an order and the guy put his hand in my face , I ordered the aush and bolani first of all the aush tasted like tomato soup not aush at all. Then the bolani smelt uncooked like I could still smell the raw dough I wouldn't recommend this place at all especially with family's. The one in Fremont Ca is way better, better food better service
author: Aisha B.

description:
I am Afghan and don't really like eating Afghan food out because my mom is an amazing cook so it is hard to like anything else.  But growing up and living in Fremont the famous De Afghanan is the only place I do like to go...My co-workers love Afghan food and told me that they saw this place and tried it and were really impressed.  I looked at the menu and sure enough it was De Afghanan. 

 I recently went with my co-worker to try it out being I work in SF and it is definitely the same DELICIOUS food that Fremont has.  

The waitress was super nice, very hospitable and explained that the one in Fremont is owned by her uncle.  We got the bolani and the triple combo plate so my friend could try the chapli kabob, the beef kabob and the chicken kabab.  It came with brown(paloe) and white rice along with the signature bread...It was sooooo good....every bite was amazing.  The place was very clean and the food definitely amazing...There was no wait and we got our food super fast.

Cant wait to go back with more friends from work. 

Try this place you wont be disappointed for the best afghan kabobs- perfection.
author: My M.

description: Oh man! one of the best kaboob place ever. They are new and they have branches in Fremont and all. Finally they are in sf now! Highly recommended. Fantastic food, we ordered bolani for appetizer and got chaplee kaboob and chicken kaboob. All of them were off the hook. Definitely coming back.
author: Cezane R.

description: I was not originally going to go here for lunch but after I saw the sign it caught my attention. I ended up getting a type of beef kabob and let me tell you.. It was the juiciest, most tender meat kabob. I ate absolutely everything. They offer a lot for such a small place. They are clean and really friendly. I definitely advise everyone to try this place out!
author: Justin N.

description: If you've never had Afghan, give it a try. A great mix of Mediterranean and Indian influences. The flavors are great.  The combo gets you the chicken, beef, and chaplee. Love the chaplee. And add the desert - a little bit of sweet without being too heavy.  The firni is my favorite. I wish I could visit more often!   The staff is very friendly too!
author: Jon C.

description:
Wow. The food is excellent. 
I recommend this place to everyone for casual dinner.
author: Natasha D.

description: Close to perfection! This restaurant may be a brushed-up hole in the wall, the decor may be quite cheesy, but the food is absolutely awesome and this is what matters. I had Triple Kabob. The Chaplee kabob was OK, not very distinctive taste; the beef kabob was nice and the chicken kabob was absolutely awesome. All three well tasty, chicken was exceptionally well done and juicy, each kabob had its own distinctive taste, nothing like one-fits-all BBQ seasoning. The dish includes two salads (great for breaking the heaviness of the meat) two kinds of rice (which, again, has its flavour, it is not just rice) and bread which goes great with complimentary chutneys (cilantro chutney and chilli chutney). I also recommend Dogh -- a drink of savoury yoghurt, ice, cucumber and spices -- goes great with meat. The establishment has a TV set, personally I don't like it, but it is possible to sit so that it is not in your field of vision. All in all highly recommended!
author: Grzegorz J.

description: We didn't know this place was here, although we go to the theater around the corner fairly often. Great food!  And the atmosphere was cozy and warm, and the wait staff was very friendly. Well done.
author: Lynn C.

description: They are finally open. This place is great. I will miss the last two Mexican restaurants that were here, but this place is a big upgrade. The inside is nicely decorated with Afghan themed artwork. The food is cooked perfectly. I have eaten in many Afghan places, this place is one of the best.
author: Bob b.

description: The best Afghan food around, hands down. The chicken, beef tikka and chapli kabob are our favorites. The bolani is good, but not as spectacular as the rest of the food. The taste and high quality are identical to the one in Fremont.
author: E Z.

description: Nice and small place and perfect for those who would like to be introduced to middle eastern food. Authentic and with a twist of fusion presentations. Mantu was authentic although the yogurt wasn't as sour as I had wanted it to be. They probably didn't ferment it long enough to give it a tart sour taste. But it was still tasty. And I'm assuming the herbs weren't as strong since this little hole in the wall accommodates a variety of different people eating here. For example I noticed the little jar of hot sauce on the table which would accommodate the Asian and Mexican customers and to those who likes spicy food. But the hot pepper sauce is definitely an Asian sauce. That was very nice of them, although I couldn't imagine eating this sauce w the wonderful food they serve. Also the dishes were served with a side of picante look instead of larger sliced tomatoes and cucumbers which I'm accustomed to when eating afghan food. The restaurant is clean with nice people so I give it a 4star for an overall rating.
author: Joy J.

description: i ordered their lamb kebab and it came with seasoned basmati rice. it was so tasty. i would come here again. its a small place and they dont do reservations so just fyi. it can get packed during dinner time.
author: Pam Y.

description: I never bother to write reviews, but couldn't stay quiet on this one. Amazing food, best value for your money I've had in a long time. Meat was perfectly grilled and seasoned, the kind of quality you expect to see only in really fancy joints. This place is special.
author: V R.

description: I don't get the hype.  Why so many five star reviews?  I got the combination kabob.  The flavoring of the meat was okay, but nothing special and the beef and the chicken were both dry, which really ruined them for me.  You also don't get very much meat, as you can see from the pictures.  The prices are nothing to write home about; you could get the same or lower prices for equivalent food in nearby restaurants instead of this six-table joint.  There are no lunch specials.  There was just nothing I really liked about my meal here and there are better Middle Eastern restaurants in the area.  I won't come back.
author: John M.

description: lamb shank and rice is amazing! meat is so tender it just slides off the bone...
author: jb h.

description: This place was awesome! Cozy and authentic. The food was very good. I had the egg plant. The bread is awesome.
author: Jason A.

description: The chicken and tekka kabob combo were tender, juicy, and nicely flavored! You can obviously tell they took their time to slow cook the meat. I'd definitely come back again and try other items on the menu. Oohhh...and the firni milk pudding dessert is a must try!!!
author: C. H.

description: This is by far the best afghan food in the area, however, the service is a bit impersonal. but their kabobs are just awesome.
author: naj a.

description: Lots to love about this place, service is great, food is excellent... and the prices are totally reasonable. I've been to 4 places in the city which serve lamb kebab and this is the only place where the lamb is tender and flavorful, absolutely outstanding!
author: mike w.

description: Had really good food. Came here with low expectations and turns out it was pretty good.
author: Billy S.

description: I love this place; it used to be in Berkeley but moved to SF so I can't get here as often as I'd like, but it's worth the journey. The kabob meat is tender and juicy (both chicken and beef). Everything is fresh and the service has always been friendly. Be warned that the space is small, so if you're going with a group going during a rush is not advised. Overall I can't get enough.
author: Meg L.

description: Great food! I am in food business and i know my food. You can try perfect taste of middle eastern food here. We had pleasant experience. I highly recommended it.
author: Hossein D.

description: Everything said before.  The roast squash is absolutely divine and as a spicy fan the jalapeño chutney/salsa at the table is incredible.
author: Jason P.

description: The best afghan food I have ever had! Ordered beef kabob and quabili pallow. Meat is so juicy and fantastic flavored.
author: C. X.

description: 3rd review in 6 years of yelping!  Stopped in for lunch during work.  Great atmosphere for a nice lunch with friends or coworkers.  The portions were healthy and everything was great.  I grew up next to a very traditional Afghan restaurant and I get a rush of nostalgia eating here.  Service was friendly and quick.  Will definitely be back!
author: drake t.

description: Oh No! DAKH, why did you leave me?!?! This is my go to afghan spot. I have eaten here more times than any other restaurant, which is why it is my first yelp review. The lady that works at the front counter, who i believe is also the owner, is the sweetest! She knows my order and my husbands order as soon as we walk in. I usually get the eggplant dish and the chicken platter with the kabuli and my husband gets the triple kabob plate well done and mild. They get it right every time! This place has never had an off day. For desert, try the baklava warmed up. It's perfection. The Berkeley location was perfect for me because it was so close but I guess i'll be driving to SF for my afghan food fix from now on!
author: Charlotte W.
